commit_message:
Clean up failed clones in VMAX driver

If the clone operation fails, clean up is not done properly in
the VMAX driver. This patch catches the exception during the
clone operation, removes the target volume, and then re-throw
the exception.

Closes-Bug: #1440154
Change-Id: I548d5da09cb66077f04b1c5f1aa168c5bd5cf02e

subject: Initialize data field of cluster_policy after policy attaching
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-26 07:45:55.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/actions/cluster_action.py'], 'message': 'Initialize data field of cluster_policy after policy attaching

During the progress of policy attaching, some useful data could
be generated, e.g. ceilometer alarm ID for scaling policy, or lb
pool ID for lb policy. This patch allows attach method of policy
to return these data and then persist them using the data field of
cluster_policy object.

Change-Id: I7c5dd2535448d133deec73d983b16df90b7fe694
'}]
commit_message:
Initialize data field of cluster_policy after policy attaching

During the progress of policy attaching, some useful data could
be generated, e.g. ceilometer alarm ID for scaling policy, or lb
pool ID for lb policy. This patch allows attach method of policy
to return these data and then persist them using the data field of
cluster_policy object.

Change-Id: I7c5dd2535448d133deec73d983b16df90b7fe694

Change-Id: I9db112dbdc2d02df88ad676a6b21018f1d6f1724'}]
commit_message:
Register ibm-db-alembic import for DB2 migrations

This patch adds the optional runtime dependency to support db2
for alembic migration, will not break the default mysql path.

This is needed for the IBM DB2 third party CI to work on this
project.

Closes-Bug: 1442524

Change-Id: I9db112dbdc2d02df88ad676a6b21018f1d6f1724

The new NET prefix introduced by I8177699b157cd3eac46e2f481f47b5d966c49b07
increases collision chances by trimming the sg_id by 3 more chars.

This patch reduces the prefix to 1 single char and also reduces the

commit_message:
Reduce prefix and suffix length in ipsets

The new NET prefix introduced by I8177699b157cd3eac46e2f481f47b5d966c49b07
increases collision chances by trimming the sg_id by 3 more chars.

This patch reduces the prefix to 1 single char and also reduces the
swap suffix to reduce the chances of collision.

Change-Id: I8a1559e173a05b2297c5cd2efa9fee7627b88a4f
Related-Bug: #1439817
Related-Bug: #1444397

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-24 06:04:43.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_iptables_firewall.py'], 'message': 'Ensure mac address added to iptables is always in unix format

When a allowed address pair entry is added with a mac format
other than unix format the ovs-vs agent keeps on restarting as
it is not able to save the proper iptables due to the error
"Error while processing VIF ports". This fix makes sure
that the mac address sent to the iptables firewall is always
in the unix format

Change-Id: I86bbf3cb2adf9b998190e472691c01d068ebab9c
Closes-Bug: #1457971
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure mac address added to iptables is always in unix format

When a allowed address pair entry is added with a mac format
other than unix format the ovs-vs agent keeps on restarting as
it is not able to save the proper iptables due to the error
"Error while processing VIF ports". This fix makes sure
that the mac address sent to the iptables firewall is always
in the unix format

Change-Id: I86bbf3cb2adf9b998190e472691c01d068ebab9c
Closes-Bug: #1457971

commit_message:
Disable meaningless sort keys in list command

The sort keys are:
For ports: 'extra'
For chassis: 'extra'
For nodes: 'properties', 'driver_info', 'extra',
           'instance_info', 'driver_internal_info'

Disable these sort keys in REST API.

Change-Id: I82d5674d14b4357d04f59187dd30ce8e848bd035
Partial-Bug: #1446146

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-15 19:38:58.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_actions.py'], 'message': 'Fixing wrong cleanup order in test "test_rebuild_server"

Some tests (see the list below) from file tempest/tempest/api/compute/
servers/test_server_actions.py will not work if we specify different IDs
of images for options "image_ref" and "image_ref_alt".

Here is these tests:
ServerActionsTestJSON.test_rebuild_server
ServerActionsTestJSON.test_rebuild_server_in_stop_state
ServerActionsTestJSON.test_resize_server_confirm

The root cause of this is wrong cleanup order in the test
"test_rebuild_server". In particular the issue is in these code lines:

    # If the server was rebuilt on a different image, restore it to the
    # original image once the test ends
    if self.image_ref_alt != self.image_ref:
        self.addCleanup(self.client.rebuild,
                        (self.server_id, self.image_ref))

For each test in file tempest/tempest/api/compute/
servers/test_server_actions.py we have the following tearDown():

    def tearDown(self):
        server = self.client.get_server(self.server_id)
        self.assertEqual(self.image_ref, server['image']['id'])
        self.server_check_teardown()
        super(ServerActionsTestJSON, self).tearDown()

But addCleanup() is called after "tearDown" methods.

We can move code lines that check the server was rebuilt to addCleanup()
and invoke this check only in those tests that are related to rebuilding
the server.

Closes-Bug: #1454755

Change-Id: I3a743f55fa223e234b3c49d1191af0b627697b74
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing wrong cleanup order in test "test_rebuild_server"

Some tests (see the list below) from file tempest/tempest/api/compute/
servers/test_server_actions.py will not work if we specify different IDs
of images for options "image_ref" and "image_ref_alt".

Here is these tests:
ServerActionsTestJSON.test_rebuild_server
ServerActionsTestJSON.test_rebuild_server_in_stop_state
ServerActionsTestJSON.test_resize_server_confirm

The root cause of this is wrong cleanup order in the test
"test_rebuild_server". In particular the issue is in these code lines:

    # If the server was rebuilt on a different image, restore it to the
    # original image once the test ends
    if self.image_ref_alt != self.image_ref:
        self.addCleanup(self.client.rebuild,
                        (self.server_id, self.image_ref))

For each test in file tempest/tempest/api/compute/
servers/test_server_actions.py we have the following tearDown():

    def tearDown(self):
        server = self.client.get_server(self.server_id)
        self.assertEqual(self.image_ref, server['image']['id'])
        self.server_check_teardown()
        super(ServerActionsTestJSON, self).tearDown()

But addCleanup() is called after "tearDown" methods.

We can move code lines that check the server was rebuilt to addCleanup()
and invoke this check only in those tests that are related to rebuilding
the server.

Closes-Bug: #1454755

Change-Id: I3a743f55fa223e234b3c49d1191af0b627697b74

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-05-25 07:15:02.000000000', 'files': ['virtualbox/functions/product.sh'], 'message': 'VBox - there are a lot of ssh.exe processes under Cygwin

When we execute the installation of the Fuel master node we are
launching ssh commands and checking messages in the file
bootstrap_admin_node.log. If the ssh processes accumulate in the
operating system you could see the following error: “The system
has no more ptys”.
Also Cygwin does not work correctly with the command

commit_message:
VBox - there are a lot of ssh.exe processes under Cygwin

When we execute the installation of the Fuel master node we are
launching ssh commands and checking messages in the file
bootstrap_admin_node.log. If the ssh processes accumulate in the
operating system you could see the following error: “The system
has no more ptys”.
Also Cygwin does not work correctly with the command
"send "res=$(for i in 1 2 3 4...)"

Change-Id: I30aab51452505e88c18abc866f88efde2d7650fb
Closes-Bug: #1457956

subject: Do not add auth token in context for noauth API mode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-25 13:22:59.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/api/test_hooks.py', 'ironic/api/hooks.py'], 'message': 'Do not add auth token in context for noauth API mode

Client can send auth token even if API works in "noauth" mode.
This behavior misinforms conductor service. Now if context
received via RPC do not contains auth token API works w/o
authentication.

Change-Id: I67f0d3dcbfa80916ae3e77d03f6cc91244ca2179
'}]
commit_message:
Do not add auth token in context for noauth API mode

Client can send auth token even if API works in "noauth" mode.
This behavior misinforms conductor service. Now if context
received via RPC do not contains auth token API works w/o
authentication.

Change-Id: I67f0d3dcbfa80916ae3e77d03f6cc91244ca2179

Delete neutron ports when the node cleaning fails

Neutron ports are not getting deleted when the node is set to clean
failed state. This commit is to delete the neutron ports even when the
node cleaning fails.

Closes-Bug:#1449581

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-12 21:56:47.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/common/quota.py'], 'message': "Don't create empty quota set requests

The way that getattr is called with the None default you will always
create a compute_kwargs dictionary with key: None values. This means
that we will always send these empty requests to the servers.

Change so that only actually changed values end up in the quota set
requests and get sent.

This cherry-pick involves part of two patches as part of the bug was
addressed by an otherwise unrelated patch.

Change-Id: I33bc3f4e1a8013ec672e995648d27513064baf26
Closes-Bug: #1451640
(cherry picked from commit 179ed18c30cea438e13ba92997d3f671e5f76a84 and
commit 911efe8fd5d7026928394e848bc410abd08c3e4d)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't create empty quota set requests

The way that getattr is called with the None default you will always
create a compute_kwargs dictionary with key: None values. This means
that we will always send these empty requests to the servers.

Change so that only actually changed values end up in the quota set
requests and get sent.

This cherry-pick involves part of two patches as part of the bug was
addressed by an otherwise unrelated patch.

Change-Id: I33bc3f4e1a8013ec672e995648d27513064baf26
Closes-Bug: #1451640
(cherry picked from commit 179ed18c30cea438e13ba92997d3f671e5f76a84 and
commit 911efe8fd5d7026928394e848bc410abd08c3e4d)

commit_message:
[install-guide] Keystone updates

Update the keystone content as follows:

1) Fix permissions issue with WSGI on RHEL/CentOS/Fedora.

2) Clarify note about disabling the keystone service with
   Apache and make it apply to all distributions.

3) Remove PKI configuration steps because the guide uses
   UUID tokens for all distributions.

4) Add workaround for location of keystone-paste.ini file on
   RHEL/CentOS/Fedora.

Change-Id: I9e3ec34be4956dd62f0f1dd9fa9b437d649e7413
Closes-Bug: #1454041
Closes-Bug: #1457850
Closes-Bug: #1454718
Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo

subject: Make sure filtered_by_ip list servers test uses correct ip filter
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-15 12:46:23.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_list_server_filters.py'], 'message': "Make sure filtered_by_ip list servers test uses correct ip filter

The default tenants are now created with both ip4 and ip6 subnets. The order
in which they appear from a 'server show' is non-deterministic. This test
was just taking the first one and using 'ip' as the search parameter. For
an ipv6 subnet it needs to use 'ip6'. This test was only failing in the
non-isolated case because the tempest isolated tenant code uses only v4.

The ip6 case is now skipped due to nova bug 1450859 which causes the ip6
filter to always return all servers.

Change-Id: I242edb56bbfc9696d290c75c73918b93295efecf
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure filtered_by_ip list servers test uses correct ip filter

The default tenants are now created with both ip4 and ip6 subnets. The order
in which they appear from a 'server show' is non-deterministic. This test
was just taking the first one and using 'ip' as the search parameter. For
an ipv6 subnet it needs to use 'ip6'. This test was only failing in the
non-isolated case because the tempest isolated tenant code uses only v4.

The ip6 case is now skipped due to nova bug 1450859 which causes the ip6
filter to always return all servers.

Change-Id: I242edb56bbfc9696d290c75c73918b93295efecf

db_get_val returns a list when there is no entry. The local
VLAN restoration code wasn't expecting that so it would result

commit_message:
Handle ports with no local VLAN entry correctly

db_get_val returns a list when there is no entry. The local
VLAN restoration code wasn't expecting that so it would result
in unhashable errors.

This fixes the issue by converting an empty list to None.

Closes-Bug: #1458712
Change-Id: I6c599bdccb1fc6a626d222541cef8dcfde0713da

commit_message:
Update pyremotevbox documentation

This commit updates the suggested version of
pyremotevbox to 0.5.0 which removes the requirement
to install a ZSI library separately. This is important
because some distributions don't have this packaged.

Change-Id: I59e2418a735830409891e84fcc048b4005241cad

commit_message:
Update hacking to fix pep8 failure

With the release of pbr 1.0.0, we need a newer version of hacking.
Update the version. hacking is manually synced from global
requirements repo, use the version from there.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/064362.html

Change-Id: Ic3ff9ad74acd57fe149e5873fefe8a99e1d701d8

commit_message:
Use session loading in cinder

Use the default session options in cinder. We then create an
authentication plugin that can be used with the session. This custom
plugin will be replaced later with one from the context.

Change-Id: I48babb4e2b0fc9f07a3a0088c3d31eabcc43905a

commit_message:
Add missing dependencies (from pip-missing-reqs)

Any explicit imports we have in magnum, we should specify
the pypi package version number in our requirements. The
pip-missing-reqs helps us find these.

Note that python-dateutil is an optional import in
the python-k8sclient AND it's not in the global requirements
so not adding that.

Here are the references to the imports for the packages
we are adding here:

alembic
-------

subject: Enable NeutronL3HA by default in Pacemaker scenario
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-19 16:47:50.000000000', 'files': ['environments/puppet-pacemaker.yaml', 'puppet/controller-puppet.yaml'], 'message': 'Enable NeutronL3HA by default in Pacemaker scenario

WARNING: NeutronL3HA must not be enabled if ControllerCount=1 or the
deployment will error. It is safe to enable in CI where we deploy
HA scenario with ControllerCount=3 but having it in the enviroment
file means people might be tempted to pass this when using
ControllerCount=1 as well, considering it maybe a needed param.

Instack passes this paraparameter only when ControllerCont>=1 see [1].

1. https://github.com/rdo-management/instack-undercloud/blob/master/scripts/instack-deploy-overcloud#L367

Change-Id: Ia4dbd5e60cc5f7eac71721fb918fee3ca7e53105
'}]
commit_message:
Enable NeutronL3HA by default in Pacemaker scenario

WARNING: NeutronL3HA must not be enabled if ControllerCount=1 or the
deployment will error. It is safe to enable in CI where we deploy
HA scenario with ControllerCount=3 but having it in the enviroment
file means people might be tempted to pass this when using
ControllerCount=1 as well, considering it maybe a needed param.

Instack passes this paraparameter only when ControllerCont>=1 see [1].

1. https://github.com/rdo-management/instack-undercloud/blob/master/scripts/instack-deploy-overcloud#L367

Change-Id: Ia4dbd5e60cc5f7eac71721fb918fee3ca7e53105

commit_message:
Reduce new token when call client object

When we create a keystoneclient object, we can use its own cache
functionality by set use_keyring to True. And also we can use cache
for novaclient by set os_cache to True. These improvements can reduce
the burden of token table in keystone.

Change-Id: I56d975e36cbf1da8ecf1df9fb83c342dfb45eb21
Closes-Bug: #1291136

ok only in SQL implementation. We need it in all of backends.
For this purpose we may use dict_to_keyval function to store

Change-Id: I19e48b3890f096326eb830c5c7b5d2cd1eba251b

commit_message:
Make lists query-able during fetching samples and meters

Query by list-element in resource_matedata works
ok only in SQL implementation. We need it in all of backends.
For this purpose we may use dict_to_keyval function to store
metadata in SQL and HBase - in these backends we store flattened
metadata as well as raw. For Mongo and DB2 we neeed only construct
correct query from user's input.
Added several tests.

This commit doesn't fix HBase issue: flattened metadata is not used during query processing.

Change-Id: I19e48b3890f096326eb830c5c7b5d2cd1eba251b

commit_message:
Evaluate alarms by their dependency order

Currently, we evaluator alarms in the order of their ids, which simply
ignore their dependency relationship. This patch introduces a way
to evaluate alarms according to the dependency chains.

Change-Id: Ie5c3ef5d11475cf64fdc944fd5e1b785aa9dfdc7
Closes-Bug: #1310500
Implements: blueprint resolve-combination-alarm-dependency-chain

commit_message:
Check image-download for redirection

Currently when you download an image without specifying
a file or redirecting the output, the image is dumped into
the console as gibberish. We can avoid this if we
check if file is being redirected or if a file is specified.

Change-Id: I257760752f05b82b935cf19fb10573ee7ff1395d

This matches the workflow of other projects like neutron
and should fix the following pbr-semver errors.

commit_message:
Revert fix that issues Unauthorized exception

This reverts the fix to properly issue an Unauthorized
exception [1] because it was a workaround, and the proper fix
was made in oslo.incubator [2] and has been sync'd [3].

[1] I930fd61a896f62a2984cca1e4d40e5d89644aa3f
[2] I3b9a20174da482f570d02319e68f46dcaa10ca9c
[3] Iab799c8209872e2faa9ec6d33a426347b6478cce

commit_message:
Don't swallow AssertionErrors

Most validation errors are in fact the user's problem, but in the case of
an AssertionError that's a real problem with Heat. We should return 500
status codes and log the tracebacks, not wrap the in validation exceptions.

Change-Id: I71d91a5413d7f026b332014487583b7f2762b322

commit_message:
Add ability for drivers to copy data preserving sparseness

Drivers can set self._sparse_copy_volume_data to opt in
to copying data in a way that preserves sparseness.

This is likely to be desired elsewhere, but currently this
patch only enables it for the NFS driver and provides a
method for other drivers to opt in, in case there are
unexpected issues in some drivers.

On the NFS driver, this prevents volume migration from
changing a volume file from sparse to fully allocated.

Change-Id: Ib74b2fb4015b805d33de42dfe60c8a97cc970b84
Closes-Bug: #1455595

commit_message:
Disable oslo.vmware test dependency on Python 3

oslo.vmware 0.12.0 still requires suds which is not compatible with
Python 3. Next oslo.vmware will uses suds-jurko. Disable the dependency
until the next oslo.vmware release.

oslo.vmware change using suds-jurko:
I699c65e4abd607ea6f377d86c45fd609569f3c2b

Blueprint nova-python3
Change-Id: Ia05c433736128f0d1a64c73b556f6283894c49c7

commit_message:
Run tests with PyMySQL on Python 3

Add test-requirements-py3.txt to use PyMySQL, instead of MySQL-python,
on Python 3.

Add a py34 test environment to tox.ini which uses
test-requirements-py3.txt and sets OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION to use
the PyMySQL connector instead of the MySQL-python connector.

This change is based on Ironic tox.ini, so I added Victor Sergeyev as
the coauthor of the patch.

Co-Authored-By: Victor Sergeyev <vsergeyev@mirantis.com>
Blueprint nova-python3
Change-Id: I5a27c7d627105b614da3cab3a87296a8e186b555

commit_message:
Fix functional tests in gate

The check-glanceclient-dsvm-functional gate job was failing due to the
functional tests not picking up valid OpenStack credentials.

Update how we aquire credentials -- fixes side effect of how tox 2.0
handles environment variables.

Change-Id: Ia665dc9673d09421508476d05039d2da8a5e1a29
Closes-bug: 1455102

commit_message:
Add Manila project support

Manila provides management of shared or distributed filesystems.

Add support for Manila project main features:
- Create/delete share
- Create/delete share-network
- Create/delete security-service
- Add security service to share network

Change-Id: I6092ce2639745801334c5a5be63062de9e79207c

commit_message:
Add domains negative test

Created domain can't be removed by simple call, it's necessary to
disable it at first and then remove it. Otherwise Forbidden exception
will be raised.

Change-Id: I20a9d58c3bcc07c5483b43f7cba13f82d177c46a

[{'number': 17, 'created': '2014-12-11 07:14:38.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/core-vendor-decomposition.rst'], 'message': 'Proposal for Neutron core and vendor code decomposition

This spec outlines the plan for addressing the pain points
that every Neutron contributor feels on a daily basis when
working with the project.

The proposed change should be implemented collaboratively,
in the same spirit of the OpenStack community.

This is initial attempt at making this project a thriving
one. We should all recognize that if nothing gets done,
Neutron will become a desolated land where just tumbleweeds
will abound.

Blueprint: core-vendor-decomposition

Change-Id: I7156edbeeed8d5e11415d3feb5b340bbe74e327f
'}]
commit_message:
Proposal for Neutron core and vendor code decomposition

This spec outlines the plan for addressing the pain points
that every Neutron contributor feels on a daily basis when
working with the project.

The proposed change should be implemented collaboratively,
in the same spirit of the OpenStack community.

This is initial attempt at making this project a thriving
one. We should all recognize that if nothing gets done,
Neutron will become a desolated land where just tumbleweeds
will abound.

Blueprint: core-vendor-decomposition

Change-Id: I7156edbeeed8d5e11415d3feb5b340bbe74e327f

commit_message:
Added test of default domain in Keystone

Default domain is part of Keystone APIv3 domains feature added in Grizzly
backward compatibility for APIv2 which is not aware of domain concept.

Summary of scope this change:
* added new variable 'default_domain_id'
  in tempest.conf (default value 'default')
* new test: default domain must exists (backward compatibility)

Change-Id: Ib77d259e2f377ff19e2cf40fa164f42c0669ea56

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-05-13 19:45:47.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/ldap/core.py'], 'message': 'Use single connection in get_all function

As the number of LDAP users increase, any keystone commands that
need to look through all of the LDAP users tend to slow down.
After some investigation, I figured out that the cause of this
is making a new connection for each user in get_all.

In get_all, it calls _get_enabled function for each LDAP user.
In _get_enabled function, a new connection from get_connection()
is created, an then "enabled" value for a user is obtained.
Therefore, the more LDAP users you have, the slower the response
will be.

If a connection is made before the for loop in get_all, get all
"enabled" values from all users, and then close the connection,
then the response from keystone commands would be faster.

This code change was tested on a VM, and it actually speeded up
many keystone commands (user-list, user-role-add, user-delete,
user-get) from 50 seconds to 4 seconds.

Closes-Bug: #1451910
Change-Id: I3f5131c9eefa066f0d8ee5127322d686e09308df
'}]
commit_message:
Use single connection in get_all function

As the number of LDAP users increase, any keystone commands that
need to look through all of the LDAP users tend to slow down.
After some investigation, I figured out that the cause of this
is making a new connection for each user in get_all.

In get_all, it calls _get_enabled function for each LDAP user.
In _get_enabled function, a new connection from get_connection()
is created, an then "enabled" value for a user is obtained.
Therefore, the more LDAP users you have, the slower the response
will be.

If a connection is made before the for loop in get_all, get all
"enabled" values from all users, and then close the connection,
then the response from keystone commands would be faster.

This code change was tested on a VM, and it actually speeded up
many keystone commands (user-list, user-role-add, user-delete,
user-get) from 50 seconds to 4 seconds.

Closes-Bug: #1451910
Change-Id: I3f5131c9eefa066f0d8ee5127322d686e09308df

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-13 09:40:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Avoid useless copy in get_instance_metadata()

API.get_instance_metadata() of nova.compute.api creates an useless copy
of a dictionary: return directly the original dictionary created by
SQLAlchemy.

Change-Id: Ifd455e70002eb9636b87f83788384127ba6edeeb
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid useless copy in get_instance_metadata()

API.get_instance_metadata() of nova.compute.api creates an useless copy
of a dictionary: return directly the original dictionary created by
SQLAlchemy.

Change-Id: Ifd455e70002eb9636b87f83788384127ba6edeeb

commit_message:
httpretty can fail in Python 3.4 with wrong LC_ALL

if LC_ALL is 'C' then installation in a tox environment fails [1].

[1] https://github.com/gabrielfalcao/HTTPretty/issues/223

Change-Id: I340c88ea7d098ca5943d60adc73f63a0af79a405

commit_message:
Support for concurrent full-stack tests

This patch introduces the last step of complete test separation for
full-stack tests - separate rabbitmq queues - in the form of rabbitmq
virtual hosts.

* This patch also renames EnvironmentFixture to FullstackFixture, for
  clarity.

Change-Id: I24776e3970a73fdd3271023da7967f2c7261621b
Closes-bug: #1452737

revisions:

Because of a recent change, docker image building cannot be done
as the root user.  This is a good thing ;)  But breaks the current
gate.

Also we have a setup_docker.sh script already in our tools directory,
so rename the script we are running to setup_gate.sh because that is

Change-Id: I8f86616fb19b4b03f34fe40acf1689f6b174ff98

commit_message:
Don't run kolla functional gate as root

Because of a recent change, docker image building cannot be done
as the root user.  This is a good thing ;)  But breaks the current
gate.

Also we have a setup_docker.sh script already in our tools directory,
so rename the script we are running to setup_gate.sh because that is
actually what the script does.

Change-Id: I8f86616fb19b4b03f34fe40acf1689f6b174ff98

commit_message:
ensure collections created on upgrade

upgrade does not check that collections exists. this can cause
issues when running upgrade before any data is inserted. this patch
creates collection on upgrade of db2nosql as it does for mongodb.

Change-Id: Iea79688ed81866c0b00aaa80f101b6f045af5bc1

subject: Fix rabbit OCF demote/stop/promote actions
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14774, 'name': 'Fuel TPI CI', 'email': 'pi-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-tpi-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-05-25 09:56:53.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/pacemaker_wrappers/manifests/rabbitmq.pp', 'files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': "Fix rabbit OCF demote/stop/promote actions

* When the rabbit node went down, its status remains 'running'
  in mnesia db for a while, so few retries (50 sec of total) are
  required in order to kick and forget this node from the cluster.
  This also requires +50 sec for actions stop & demote timeout.
* The rabbit master score in the CIB is retained after the current
  master moved manually. This is wrong and the score must be reset
  ASAP for post-demote and post-stop as well.
* The demoted node must be kicked from cluster by other nodes
  on post-demote processing.
* Post-demote should stop the rabbit app at the node being demoted as
  this node should be kicked from the cluster by other nodes.
  Instead, it stops the app at the *other* nodes and brings full
  cluster downtime.
* The check to join should be only done at the post-start and not at
  the post-promote, otherwise the node being promoted may think it
  is clustered with some node while the join check reports it as
  already clustered with another one.
  (the regression was caused by https://review.openstack.org/184671)
* Change `hostname` call to `crm_node -n` via $THIS_PCMK_NODE
  everywhere to ensure we are using correct pacemaker node name
* Handle empty values for OCF_RESKEY_CRM_meta_notify_* by reporting
  the resource as not running. This will rerun resource and restore
  its state, eventually.

Closes-bug: #1436812
Closes-bug: #1455761

Change-Id: Ib01c1731b4f06e6b643a4bca845828f7db507ad3
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix rabbit OCF demote/stop/promote actions

* When the rabbit node went down, its status remains 'running'
  in mnesia db for a while, so few retries (50 sec of total) are
  required in order to kick and forget this node from the cluster.
  This also requires +50 sec for actions stop & demote timeout.
* The rabbit master score in the CIB is retained after the current
  master moved manually. This is wrong and the score must be reset
  ASAP for post-demote and post-stop as well.
* The demoted node must be kicked from cluster by other nodes
  on post-demote processing.
* Post-demote should stop the rabbit app at the node being demoted as
  this node should be kicked from the cluster by other nodes.
  Instead, it stops the app at the *other* nodes and brings full
  cluster downtime.
* The check to join should be only done at the post-start and not at
  the post-promote, otherwise the node being promoted may think it
  is clustered with some node while the join check reports it as
  already clustered with another one.
  (the regression was caused by https://review.openstack.org/184671)
* Change `hostname` call to `crm_node -n` via $THIS_PCMK_NODE
  everywhere to ensure we are using correct pacemaker node name
* Handle empty values for OCF_RESKEY_CRM_meta_notify_* by reporting
  the resource as not running. This will rerun resource and restore
  its state, eventually.

Closes-bug: #1436812
Closes-bug: #1455761

Change-Id: Ib01c1731b4f06e6b643a4bca845828f7db507ad3
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Remove the custom duplicate check on cluster template update

There is no need for a custom check here, we can let sqlalchemy
enforce the uniqueness constraints. Changed the exception message
to conform to other duplication checks.

Change-Id: Ia80be1d1a40910c9cc30c2fa8d4253c370fdb2df

commit_message:
Refactor internal API of update subnet routes

Refactor internal API of update subnet routes.
1 Prepare code to easy add vpn routes processing
2 Prevent updating routes for explicitly associated subnets in case of
default VPC route table reassociation.
3 Make sequence of API parameters more natural.

Change-Id: Ifcb9b4541156449da1ff74d171a3ac35266577b9

commit_message:
Change RadosGW port to 35357 in granular deployment

Commit I1ef8030b39256a17ef3b1dc1e1061c756d7392a6 changed the default port only
in ceph module. It gets overwritten in ceph-radosgw task used in
granular deployment.

Change-Id: I2ac378bd8fd5a960d7983904b3395c00d5827d60
Closes-Bug: 1446704

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-22 17:28:46.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_caching.py', 'shade/__init__.py', 'shade/_tasks.py'], 'message': 'Support PUT in Image v2 API

Not only is there a difference between put and task uploads, there is
also a difference between v1 put and v2 put. Of course there is.

Co-Authored-By: David Shrewsbury <shrewsbury.dave@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I63f8dd4279cf242da7e76018580479968bc9aaef
'}]
commit_message:
Support PUT in Image v2 API

Not only is there a difference between put and task uploads, there is
also a difference between v1 put and v2 put. Of course there is.

Co-Authored-By: David Shrewsbury <shrewsbury.dave@gmail.com>

subject: [HDP] java64_home not pointing at default-installed JDK for plugin
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6116, 'name': 'li,chen', 'email': 'shchenli@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'chen-li'}, {'_account_id': 7213, 'name': 'Sahara Hadoop Cluster CI', 'email': 'elastic-hadoop-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'savanna-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7710, 'name': 'Sergey Reshetnyak', 'email': 'sreshetniak@mirantis.com', 'username': 'sreshetniak'}, {'_account_id': 8090, 'name': 'Chad Roberts', 'email': 'croberts@redhat.com', 'username': 'croberts'}, {'_account_id': 8411, 'name': 'Andrew Lazarev', 'email': 'alazarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'alazarev'}, {'_account_id': 12038, 'name': 'Vitaly Gridnev', 'email': 'gridnevvvit@gmail.com', 'username': 'vgridnev'}, {'_account_id': 13919, 'name': 'Evgeny Sikachev', 'email': 'esikachov@gmail.com', 'username': 'esikachev'}, {'_account_id': 13953, 'name': 'Elise Gafford', 'email': 'egafford@redhat.com', 'username': 'egafford'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-19 21:19:57.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/plugins/hdp/versions/version_1_3_2/resources/default-cluster.template', 'sahara/plugins/hdp/versions/version_2_0_6/resources/default-cluster.template'], 'message': "[HDP] java64_home not pointing at default-installed JDK for plugin

At this time HDP's java64_home property defaults to /opt/jdk1.6.0_31.
However, the now-default openjdk element installs to /usr/lib/jvm/java-openjdk.
If nodes are connected to the internet at cluster spinup time, this does not
cause an overt error, but querying for JDK location will return error code 2,
resulting in no -j argument being passed to 'ambari-server setup -s', which in
turn will result in a download of Oracle's JDK and successful installation. In
the case that the nodes cannot connect to the internet (which should be a
success case with a pre-installed VM image,) cluster creation fails at this
stage.

This patch updates java64_home to the default JAVA_HOME from the openjdk
element.

Change-Id: I1d53db67341626190e7240f0ae4165f91d364a2c
Closes-bug: 1453165
"}]
commit_message:
[HDP] java64_home not pointing at default-installed JDK for plugin

At this time HDP's java64_home property defaults to /opt/jdk1.6.0_31.
However, the now-default openjdk element installs to /usr/lib/jvm/java-openjdk.
If nodes are connected to the internet at cluster spinup time, this does not
cause an overt error, but querying for JDK location will return error code 2,
resulting in no -j argument being passed to 'ambari-server setup -s', which in
turn will result in a download of Oracle's JDK and successful installation. In
the case that the nodes cannot connect to the internet (which should be a
success case with a pre-installed VM image,) cluster creation fails at this
stage.

This patch updates java64_home to the default JAVA_HOME from the openjdk
element.

Change-Id: I1d53db67341626190e7240f0ae4165f91d364a2c
Closes-bug: 1453165

subject: Fix playbooks for OpenStack CI
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2889, 'name': 'Aeva Black', 'email': 'aeva.online@gmail.com', 'username': 'tenbrae'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 8106, 'name': 'Haomeng,Wang', 'email': 'wanghaomeng@gmail.com', 'username': 'whaom'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 13997, 'name': 'SHIGEMATSU Mitsuhiro', 'email': 'shigematsu.mitsuhiro@lab.ntt.co.jp', 'username': 'pshige'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 33, 'created': '2015-05-16 06:18:48.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-configdrives/tasks/ssh_public_key_path.yaml', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-create-vm-nodes/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-prepare-for-test/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ironic-install/templates/dnsmasq.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/ironic-enroll/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/test-bifrost.yaml', 'playbooks/roles/ironic-install/tasks/main.yml', 'scripts/test-bifrost.sh'], 'message': "Fix playbooks for OpenStack CI

The OpenStack CI systems are preconfigured with various components
such as databases, message queues, caching dns resolvers.  The
CI systems also lack things like public/private key pairs, and
known_hosts files.

Due to this, a number of minor changes are required in Bifrost's test
sequence to account for and route around these differences in order
to allow test jobs to run until completion. This also demonstrated
that some steps have been operating under the assumption that the user
likely already had certain things installed, so service restart
tweeks have also been necessary.

Added a step to restart libvirt-bin in order to allow it to pickup
new capabilities due to the install of the qemu emulator.

Added additional steps to collect kernel log and `virsh capabilities`
output.

Removed MySQL step nolog statements as the password is automatically
suppressed and it suppresses information that could be required for
troubleshooting.

Added in specific username/password logic for MySQL steps if ZUUL
is detected in order to use the OpenStack CI defaults.

Changed VM test node creation to occur upon every attempt.

Extended the startup wait for a test node to be 900 seconds from 600
seconds.

Added collection of process list and listening sockets if ZUUL is
detected.

Added report of VM console log and various commands to assist in
troubleshooting a failing job.

Added auto-generation of a user ssh keypair if absent when operating
in OpenStack CI.

Added explicit adjustment of iptables to permit connections on the
network interface that the hosts are being provisioned via on
8080/tcp and 6385/tcp.

Change-Id: I3c37c5c21af0aefb5007c5775043f7f837389c2d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix playbooks for OpenStack CI

The OpenStack CI systems are preconfigured with various components
such as databases, message queues, caching dns resolvers.  The
CI systems also lack things like public/private key pairs, and
known_hosts files.

Due to this, a number of minor changes are required in Bifrost's test
sequence to account for and route around these differences in order
to allow test jobs to run until completion. This also demonstrated
that some steps have been operating under the assumption that the user
likely already had certain things installed, so service restart
tweeks have also been necessary.

Added a step to restart libvirt-bin in order to allow it to pickup
new capabilities due to the install of the qemu emulator.

Added additional steps to collect kernel log and `virsh capabilities`
output.

Removed MySQL step nolog statements as the password is automatically
suppressed and it suppresses information that could be required for
troubleshooting.

Added in specific username/password logic for MySQL steps if ZUUL
is detected in order to use the OpenStack CI defaults.

Changed VM test node creation to occur upon every attempt.

Extended the startup wait for a test node to be 900 seconds from 600
seconds.

Added collection of process list and listening sockets if ZUUL is
detected.

Added report of VM console log and various commands to assist in
troubleshooting a failing job.

Added auto-generation of a user ssh keypair if absent when operating
in OpenStack CI.

Added explicit adjustment of iptables to permit connections on the
network interface that the hosts are being provisioned via on
8080/tcp and 6385/tcp.

Change-Id: I3c37c5c21af0aefb5007c5775043f7f837389c2d

commit_message:
fix subnet-create call for demo-net

(neutron client version: 2.5.0)

The option is --dns-nameservers not --dns_namservers and the
subnet-create subcommand expects the NETWORK and CIDR to be adjacent
args.

Change-Id: I4f776632902fd001c38ee5c8c87a213883ca87be

commit_message:
Find root stack ID with database operations

This change adds a (currently unused) database function
stack_get_root_id to find the root stack ID for any stack.

Scheduler hints are moved to using Stack.root_stack_id() in this change.
Remaining uses of Stack.root_stack() will switch to using
Stack.root_stack_id() later in the series.

Change-Id: I9914b0df5af119edea6346db0d7c62124fbb1313
Partial-Bug: #1455589

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 19:26:46.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_lib/openstack/common/_i18n.py', 'ironic_lib/openstack/common/imageutils.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I779d8df5872887d5d8ec44012d792b59b0cf4f64
"}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I779d8df5872887d5d8ec44012d792b59b0cf4f64

commit_message:
Replace 'balance-xor' bonding test by mixed

We can't test bonding using 'balance-xor' mode,
because current 'fuel-devops' implementation doesn't
support links aggregation on bridge side.
Replacing 'deploy_bonding_balance_xor' test by new
'deploy_bonding_mixed' test which deploys environment
using NovaNetwork+Vlan and configures three types of
bonds on nodes.

Change-Id: I4250d3c2053cb04428301dc819ce4dc33c04f72a
Partial-bug: #1319413

commit_message:
Fix 'ha_destroy_controllers'

Wait for OSTF HA checks passed before doing any action with cluster.

To get it working, pacemaker resources should be in working state.
It is checked in the https://review.openstack.org/#/c/178864/

Change-Id: If77442014d8a97ce47b7281b816ea1a35de942e3
Depends-On:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/178864/
Closes-Bug:#1457831

commit_message:
Extend verify_network() and add output of verification errors.

- Add @retry with count=2 to the method verify_network() to
  perform additional verify if an error occured from first try.

- Add logging of verification error, like it shown in UI.
  Example of the logging: http://paste.openstack.org/show/232435/

Change-Id: I84d34788e7ff2e35fb8b428604f5de069ab8b58f
Closes-Bug:#1458071

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-05-22 20:06:02.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/ceph/manifests/osds/osd.pp'], 'message': 'Fix successful deployment with all non-working monitors

*Disable timeout for command "ceph-deploy osd activate".
 Command "ceph-deploy osd activate" has its own timeout and if cluster
 is not accessible for this time, it exits with error.
*Decrease try number for "ceph-deploy osd activate", 6 is too many
 but 3 - enough.
*Fix messages "WARN: Unrecognised escape sequence"

Change-Id: I806aa3fd7a7420f02ba69470642e2bc3eb88fbd4
Partial-bug: #1457487
Closes-bug: #1442214
'}]
commit_message:
Fix successful deployment with all non-working monitors

*Disable timeout for command "ceph-deploy osd activate".
 Command "ceph-deploy osd activate" has its own timeout and if cluster
 is not accessible for this time, it exits with error.
*Decrease try number for "ceph-deploy osd activate", 6 is too many
 but 3 - enough.
*Fix messages "WARN: Unrecognised escape sequence"

Change-Id: I806aa3fd7a7420f02ba69470642e2bc3eb88fbd4
Partial-bug: #1457487
Closes-bug: #1442214

commit_message:
Disable rabbitmq management plugin

There is a known security issue exist in the
management plugin for RabbitMQ <3.4.3, so it
has to be disabled by default.

Closes-bug: #1450443
Closes-bug: #1455761

Change-Id: Ic01c26200f6019a8112b1c5fb04a282e64b3b3e6
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

Update the stack state as late as possible

The event and notifications do not look the stack up in
the DB so we can rely on the in memory status.

commit_message:
Add 'eno*' interfaces to embedded_nics

On certain systems, the embedded NICs appear as eno1, eno2, etc.
This patch adds 'eno' to 'em' and 'eth' as interface names that
should be considered embedded NICs.

Change-Id: Icc49596573bdbb8af25f934a647f0a2ab82adaa5

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6577, 'name': 'Sergey Kraynev', 'email': 'sergejyit@gmail.com', 'username': 'skraynev'}, {'_account_id': 6899, 'name': 'Sirushti Murugesan', 'email': 'sirushtim@gmail.com', 'username': 'sirushtim'}, {'_account_id': 7385, 'name': 'Thomas Herve', 'email': 'therve@redhat.com', 'username': 'therve'}, {'_account_id': 7404, 'name': 'Ethan Lynn', 'email': 'xuanlangjian@gmail.com', 'username': 'GaryLynn'}, {'_account_id': 8246, 'name': 'Qiming Teng', 'email': 'tengqm@outlook.com', 'username': 'tengqm'}, {'_account_id': 9751, 'name': 'IBM DB2 CI', 'email': 'scecd@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmdb2', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11034, 'name': 'Yanyan Hu', 'email': 'huyanyan84@gmail.com', 'username': 'yanyanhu'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-24 22:44:52.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/template.py', 'heat/engine/resources/__init__.py', 'heat/engine/clients/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Do not verify requirements on extension loading

The heat gate is broken due to other libraries pinning
on pbr<1.0

Stevedore extension loading currently has verify_requirements=True.
This change removes this to use the default of False. Loading extensions
is likely the wrong place to be enforcing requirements versions of
libraries that heat depends on, so lets not do it.

This is likely to also improve heat robustness for deployments with
inconsistent dependencies, not just this current heat breakage.

Change-Id: Ifee37e00412e824eead9ba1435ea5a328ff3df58
Closes-Bug: #1458399
'}]
commit_message:
Do not verify requirements on extension loading

The heat gate is broken due to other libraries pinning
on pbr<1.0

Stevedore extension loading currently has verify_requirements=True.
This change removes this to use the default of False. Loading extensions
is likely the wrong place to be enforcing requirements versions of
libraries that heat depends on, so lets not do it.

This is likely to also improve heat robustness for deployments with
inconsistent dependencies, not just this current heat breakage.

Change-Id: Ifee37e00412e824eead9ba1435ea5a328ff3df58
Closes-Bug: #1458399

subject: Run functional tests using virtualenvs in devstack
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-05-12 13:46:39.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/gate/gate_hook.sh', 'devstack/apache-gnocchi.template', 'devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Run functional tests using virtualenvs in devstack

The functional tests are failing because keystone scripts traverse
their own requirements when they start up and die if there is no
match. Since we wish to use requirements that are uncapped we can
constrain the impact of other requirements setting USE_VENV=True
when setting up the devstack.

Gnocchi will be run its own virtualenv as well. The call to
install_gnocchi is replaced with stack_install_service gnocchi which
does the necessary environment variable setting to ensure that pip
will use the virtualenv when doing installs.

Depends-On: I3e7ac39eb43cdc4f656e0c90f3bfb23545722aef
Change-Id: Ib1e0cd087d11b317193d75110795e70a9f828a60
'}]
commit_message:
Run functional tests using virtualenvs in devstack

The functional tests are failing because keystone scripts traverse
their own requirements when they start up and die if there is no
match. Since we wish to use requirements that are uncapped we can
constrain the impact of other requirements setting USE_VENV=True
when setting up the devstack.

Gnocchi will be run its own virtualenv as well. The call to
install_gnocchi is replaced with stack_install_service gnocchi which
does the necessary environment variable setting to ensure that pip
will use the virtualenv when doing installs.

Depends-On: I3e7ac39eb43cdc4f656e0c90f3bfb23545722aef
Change-Id: Ib1e0cd087d11b317193d75110795e70a9f828a60

subject: Image properties in scenario tests
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-05-13 08:19:09.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/manager.py', 'etc/tempest.conf.sample', 'tempest/config.py'], 'message': 'Image properties in scenario tests

Some images require additional properties.
This change adds dictionary option "img_properties"
to the "scenario" config section.
For example, to work with Parallels Containers, specify vm_mode:
img_properties = vm_mode:exe

By occasion, we fix handling properties in _image_create in scenario/manager.py:
disk_format is an x-image-meta-* option, and kernel_id, ramdisk_id are properties.

Change-Id: I2d3714eb899faad67a867a630c1d72d1fd8ee74f
'}]
commit_message:
Image properties in scenario tests

Some images require additional properties.
This change adds dictionary option "img_properties"
to the "scenario" config section.
For example, to work with Parallels Containers, specify vm_mode:
img_properties = vm_mode:exe

By occasion, we fix handling properties in _image_create in scenario/manager.py:
disk_format is an x-image-meta-* option, and kernel_id, ramdisk_id are properties.

Change-Id: I2d3714eb899faad67a867a630c1d72d1fd8ee74f

subject: Add networking-ofagent repo to Neutron
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-14 06:01:13.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Add networking-ofagent repo to Neutron

According to procedure defined in [1], this patch proposes Neutron
to embrace networking-ofagent within its fold. This project is about
providing an alternative L2 mechanism using node-local OpenFlow
controllers.

For more information on networking-ofagent:
    https://github.com/stackforge/networking-ofagent

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/doc/source/devref/sub_projects.rst

Change-Id: Id186c383092e8478668a8797446320c41a69fffc
'}]
commit_message:
Add networking-ofagent repo to Neutron

According to procedure defined in [1], this patch proposes Neutron
to embrace networking-ofagent within its fold. This project is about
providing an alternative L2 mechanism using node-local OpenFlow
controllers.

For more information on networking-ofagent:
    https://github.com/stackforge/networking-ofagent

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/doc/source/devref/sub_projects.rst

Change-Id: Id186c383092e8478668a8797446320c41a69fffc

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-05 10:14:11.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Replace suds test dependency with suds-jurko

suds-jurko is actively maintained (latest commit in december 2014) and supports
Python 3, whereas suds doesn't seem to be maintained anymore (last release in
2010).

suds-jurko is a drop-in replacement for suds, both packages provide the same
Python module.

This change depends on the same change for oslo.vmware:
"Use suds-jurko on Python 2".

Blueprint nova-python3
Depends-On: I699c65e4abd607ea6f377d86c45fd609569f3c2b
Change-Id: I453ce915a31ca473edb52456be66d544349d571e
'}]
commit_message:
Replace suds test dependency with suds-jurko

suds-jurko is actively maintained (latest commit in december 2014) and supports
Python 3, whereas suds doesn't seem to be maintained anymore (last release in
2010).

suds-jurko is a drop-in replacement for suds, both packages provide the same
Python module.

This change depends on the same change for oslo.vmware:
"Use suds-jurko on Python 2".

Blueprint nova-python3
Depends-On: I699c65e4abd607ea6f377d86c45fd609569f3c2b
Change-Id: I453ce915a31ca473edb52456be66d544349d571e

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-05-25 04:20:41.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/unit/conductor/handlers/test_docker_conductor.py', 'magnum/conductor/handlers/docker_conductor.py'], 'message': "Catch common Exception in container conductor

Currently, docker client and docker_client in Magnum dones't handle connection
exceptions, if connection exceptions come out, no handlers in conductor, so
the rpc api call will wait until timeout error and report client as rpc
timeout errors.

This patch adds a new decorator to wrap method in container conductor methods
to catch common exception and raise ContainerException to avoid api service
get time out error.

After applied this path, connection error will be like this:

taget@taget-ThinkStation-P300:~$ magnum container-create < container.json
ERROR: Docker internal Error: ('Connection aborted.', error(111, 'ECONNREFUSED
 ... ')) (HTTP 500)

Besides, add 1 new test cases for _find_container_by_name.

Closes-Bug: #1457366
Change-Id: Ifd2485a161ba53ef3a067eba0fe64a6548ce6637
"}]
commit_message:
Catch common Exception in container conductor

Currently, docker client and docker_client in Magnum dones't handle connection
exceptions, if connection exceptions come out, no handlers in conductor, so
the rpc api call will wait until timeout error and report client as rpc
timeout errors.

This patch adds a new decorator to wrap method in container conductor methods
to catch common exception and raise ContainerException to avoid api service
get time out error.

After applied this path, connection error will be like this:

taget@taget-ThinkStation-P300:~$ magnum container-create < container.json
ERROR: Docker internal Error: ('Connection aborted.', error(111, 'ECONNREFUSED
 ... ')) (HTTP 500)

Besides, add 1 new test cases for _find_container_by_name.

Closes-Bug: #1457366
Change-Id: Ifd2485a161ba53ef3a067eba0fe64a6548ce6637

commit_message:
Fix a bug in scaleutils.truncate_desired

The cluster's current min_size/max_size should be used to truncate
desired capacity only when new min_size/max_size parameter is not
given. There is bug in current implementation for this logic and
this patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I132181fed57d3941ac6131e8b284ad17859e2222
Closes-Bug: #1456124

subject: Replace sdk user_reference module with profile
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-25 07:50:44.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/drivers/openstack/sdk.py', 'senlin/engine/environment.py'], 'message': "Replace sdk user_reference module with profile

Two changes are made:

1. user_reference module has been replaced by profile module in
   latest release of python-openstacksdk. This patch makes some
   modifications in senlin sdk driver to follow this change.

2. Set verify_requirements parameter to default False when creating
   stevedore ExtensionManager. That is the reason why the gate broke
   for pbr version confliction in stevedore. So let's make this change
   temporarily.

Note: these two changes need to be made in the same patch. Otherwise
there will be circular dependency.

Change-Id: I83f3895c38acd14ec1f8a6f11cb89b3ce4d029d9
"}]
commit_message:
Replace sdk user_reference module with profile

Two changes are made:

1. user_reference module has been replaced by profile module in
   latest release of python-openstacksdk. This patch makes some
   modifications in senlin sdk driver to follow this change.

2. Set verify_requirements parameter to default False when creating
   stevedore ExtensionManager. That is the reason why the gate broke
   for pbr version confliction in stevedore. So let's make this change
   temporarily.

Note: these two changes need to be made in the same patch. Otherwise
there will be circular dependency.

Change-Id: I83f3895c38acd14ec1f8a6f11cb89b3ce4d029d9

commit_message:
Ensure the rabbit-fence daemon started and respawned

W/o this fix, if the daemon crashed, it
would remain stopped. Also, the rabbit fence
daemon will crash on start, when there is no
/var/run/rabbitmq piddir exist.

The solution is
* add the respawn option to
the daemon's upstart (TODO for Centos inittab)
* and ensure the piddir
created by upstart/init.d before starting the daemon.

This also requires to add the rabbitmq and
fuel-rabbit-fence packages as a dependency.

Closes-bug: #1456791

Change-Id: I4e71eb9e4aa4ff3b877aa89a37d82215740aaeab
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

subject: PXE/ISCSI: Call partx after partioning the disk
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1882, 'name': 'dave-mcnally', 'email': 'dave.mcnally@hpe.com', 'username': 'dave-mcnally'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 6969, 'name': 'Michael Kerrin', 'email': 'michael.kerrin@hpe.com', 'username': 'mkerrin'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10765, 'name': 'Andre Aranha', 'email': 'afaranha@lsd.ufcg.edu.br', 'username': 'afaranha'}, {'_account_id': 12081, 'name': 'IBM xCAT CI', 'email': 'xcat@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-xcat-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-02-26 15:31:21.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/test_disk_partitioner.py', 'etc/ironic/rootwrap.d/ironic-utils.filters', 'ironic/common/disk_partitioner.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_deploy_utils.py'], 'message': "PXE/ISCSI: Call partx after partioning the disk

The _wait_for_disk_to_become_available function from
common/disk_partitioner.py calls fuser to check if the is not being held
by another process, but it doesn't actually check if the partitions of the
device is available after the disk is partitioned. This patch adds a call
to partx -u to make the kernel re-read the partition table of the device
and then list the partitions to verify if they are really available.

Closes-Bug: #1403887
Change-Id: I880ef1120f98e32d802f52db36955da95f7daeb7
"}]
commit_message:
PXE/ISCSI: Call partx after partioning the disk

The _wait_for_disk_to_become_available function from
common/disk_partitioner.py calls fuser to check if the is not being held
by another process, but it doesn't actually check if the partitions of the
device is available after the disk is partitioned. This patch adds a call
to partx -u to make the kernel re-read the partition table of the device
and then list the partitions to verify if they are really available.

Closes-Bug: #1403887
Change-Id: I880ef1120f98e32d802f52db36955da95f7daeb7

commit_message:
Tests don't override default auth methods/plugins

The tests were overriding the default auth methods and plugins even
when the defaults work fine. The tests should use the defaults when
it makes sense so that the test config is easier to change.

bp stevedore

Change-Id: Iefb98d90f22dd0852a2b894c48db1a570bd3d4bf

commit_message:
Correct tests setting auth methods to a non-list

The auth methods config option is a list, not a string. In most
cases the tests were setting the auth methods when the test
didn't need to, so the line was just removed.

Change-Id: I0f0cbfe84bc37c8a0bc5a3b2b3669c86e6b5996f

commit_message:
Switch from MySQL-python to PyMySQL

As discussed in the Liberty Design Summit "Moving apps to Python 3"
cross-project workshop, the way forward in the near future is to
switch to the pure-python PyMySQL library as a default.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-cross-project-python3

Change-Id: I040ee1b2e14ba5c36de85cb042bbaff41dbbaf3a

subject: Removed the '_safe_message' variable from the API exceptions
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-06 15:33:10.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/exceptions.py', 'horizon/tables/actions.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/swift.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/containers/tests.py', 'horizon/test/tests/messages.py'], 'message': "Removed the '_safe_message' variable from the API exceptions

The variable _safe_message is linked to logic that is either no
longer used or not implemented. Removing the variable is a part
of improving the exception message by using 1 source to generate
the exception message

Partially Implements: blueprint improve-error-message-details-for-usability

Change-Id: Ied1acf22790cdedad685990fc628462d51b1477e
"}]
commit_message:
Removed the '_safe_message' variable from the API exceptions

The variable _safe_message is linked to logic that is either no
longer used or not implemented. Removing the variable is a part
of improving the exception message by using 1 source to generate
the exception message

Partially Implements: blueprint improve-error-message-details-for-usability

commit_message:
ngReorg - align module names with directory

This commit aligns module names with their directory
structure.

This is one step in a larger effort to restructure the Angular
source. See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/176152/ for the
full set of planned changes.

Change-Id: I3f48ebaef23d6249983f33b1a4710cc1fe3ef789
Partial-Bug: #1454880

commit_message:
Restructure builds to allow more flexibility

As a restructure, nothing is changed from the original behaviour and
naming despite the file structure changing. The symlinks to build had
to be updated generating lots of "deleted" and "new_file".

The new structure is:

docker/${base_distro}/${type}/${container}

base_distro == centos, ubuntu, fedora, etc
type == source, binary, rdo

type rdo is a symlink to binary for backwards compatibility

Two new flags are added to the build-all script to support the ability
to support different base distros and a flag to support binary or source
containers.

There are several added folders that are empty to hold the directory
structure for future containers of these types.

To use a prefix other than centos-rdo- you can set PREFIX in the toplevel
directory .buildconf file

Change-Id: Ifc7bac0d827470f506c8b5c004a833da9ce13b90

subject: "Report a bug" link in HTML manuals automatically fills in bug's tag
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-05-22 21:18:00.000000000', 'files': ['openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/static/js/docs.js', 'README.rst', 'doc/source/conf.py', 'openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/script_footer.html'], 'message': '"Report a bug" link in HTML manuals automatically fills in bug's tag

The "Report a bug" link in the HTML manuals populate information about the page.
Since manuals within openstack-manuals project have their own tag within
launchpad, this patch automatically tags the bug using a tag defined in conf.py.

Change-Id: I3c9214a4f5a00648d325b4acaa493057ab0e4821
Closes-Bug: #1342373
'}]
commit_message:
"Report a bug" link in HTML manuals automatically fills in bug's tag

The "Report a bug" link in the HTML manuals populate information about the page.
Since manuals within openstack-manuals project have their own tag within
launchpad, this patch automatically tags the bug using a tag defined in conf.py.

Change-Id: I3c9214a4f5a00648d325b4acaa493057ab0e4821
Closes-Bug: #1342373

subject: Kazoo had a new release with fixes projects would like
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-12 18:58:08.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Kazoo had a new release with fixes projects would like

Some of the things addressed:

- Locks for tooz that work better
- Native eventlet handler support
- Ability to close a client (silently closing
  if it was never started in the first part)
  for taskflow

Others at the following:

https://github.com/python-zk/kazoo/blob/2.1/CHANGES.rst

Change-Id: I6146ed0aa94a7d361235582948c0ece07b08bfd9
'}]
commit_message:
Kazoo had a new release with fixes projects would like

Some of the things addressed:

- Locks for tooz that work better
- Native eventlet handler support
- Ability to close a client (silently closing
  if it was never started in the first part)
  for taskflow

Others at the following:

https://github.com/python-zk/kazoo/blob/2.1/CHANGES.rst

Change-Id: I6146ed0aa94a7d361235582948c0ece07b08bfd9

revisions:

This bug is opened at https://github.com/python-zk/kazoo/issues/315

The PR fix is at https://github.com/python-zk/kazoo/pull/316

Until that merges and is released reduce the required version to a
known set that is known to work (vs one that is not).

Depends-On: I4e2190434247f428ceb7482df7e9c7222ed9c4dc

Change-Id: I35878e6e76d3cc2322cc0a29bec3a6c0898e772f
'}]
commit_message:
Kazoo 2.1 has a bug which is breaking tooz gate

This bug is opened at https://github.com/python-zk/kazoo/issues/315

The PR fix is at https://github.com/python-zk/kazoo/pull/316

Until that merges and is released reduce the required version to a
known set that is known to work (vs one that is not).

Depends-On: I4e2190434247f428ceb7482df7e9c7222ed9c4dc

Change-Id: I35878e6e76d3cc2322cc0a29bec3a6c0898e772f

commit_message:
[WIP] Utilize baylock for conductor horizontal-scale

The bay operations below will be executed with exclusive lock.
When a bay is locked, it will reject other operations until the
current operation finishes.

* bay-create
* bay-update
* bay-delete

subject: Update for pip 7.0.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-24 01:51:40.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/group_vars/all.yml'], 'message': 'Update for pip 7.0.0

The trusted host option when installing from a domain that is not
https is no longer optional. This change adds a domain variable to
the groupvars/all.yml and ensures that the get-pip.py installation
process is using the `--trusted-host`` flag and is pointed back at
the domain name used in the "openstack_upstream_domain".

Change-Id: I18539cf4b8790c096d44a0de4985b9d4293d95e3
(cherry picked from commit 473881dcae890fd8520f5bb1777e907d6e8f3abd)
'}]
commit_message:
Update for pip 7.0.0

The trusted host option when installing from a domain that is not
https is no longer optional. This change adds a domain variable to
the groupvars/all.yml and ensures that the get-pip.py installation
process is using the `--trusted-host`` flag and is pointed back at
the domain name used in the "openstack_upstream_domain".

Change-Id: I18539cf4b8790c096d44a0de4985b9d4293d95e3
(cherry picked from commit 473881dcae890fd8520f5bb1777e907d6e8f3abd)

Note that Kernels prior to 3.18 did not include geneve support
natively.  Also link to the OVS FAQ document that covers this issue

Wikipedia's list of common misspellings [1] has a machine-readable
version.  This patch fixes those misspellings mentioned in the list
which don't have multiple right variants (as e.g. "accension", which can
be both "accession" and "ascension"), such misspellings are left
untouched.  The list of changes was manually re-checked for false
positives.

[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Lists_of_common_misspellings/For_machines

Change-Id: I44d53a807a6d2e9910daab939f4c0b7768c07ad9
Signed-off-by: Martin Kletzander <mkletzan@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix common misspellings

Wikipedia's list of common misspellings [1] has a machine-readable
version.  This patch fixes those misspellings mentioned in the list
which don't have multiple right variants (as e.g. "accension", which can
be both "accession" and "ascension"), such misspellings are left
untouched.  The list of changes was manually re-checked for false
positives.

[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Lists_of_common_misspellings/For_machines

Change-Id: I44d53a807a6d2e9910daab939f4c0b7768c07ad9
Signed-off-by: Martin Kletzander <mkletzan@redhat.com>

subject: make registering a cli opt on a filter object work.
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-05-23 04:41:42.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_cfgfilter.py', 'oslo_config/tests/test_cfgfilter.py', 'oslo_config/cfgfilter.py'], 'message': "make registering a cli opt on a filter object work.

Change the behaviour of ConfigFilter.register_cli_opt to:

1. If the opt is already registered before parsing, then registering
just import it.
2. if the opt is not registered before, then raise an exception named

CliOptRegisteredError.
By adding this modification, the behaviour of
ConfigFilter.register_cli_opt looks more consistent to
ConfigOpts.register_cli_opt. The solution to the question mentioned in
Bug#1366946 should be like this:

from oslo_config import cfg
from oslo_config import cfgfilter

import sys

c = cfg.CONF
c.register_cli_opt(
cfg.BoolOpt('myflag',
default=False,
help='turn on myflag',
)
)
c(sys.argv[1:])

f = cfgfilter.ConfigFilter(c)
f.register_cli_opt(
cfg.BoolOpt('myflag',
default=False,
help='turn on myflag',
)
)

print f.myflag

Closes-Bug: #1366946
Change-Id: I94df9409f72807461370b4aaf8eb2543c52a89bb
"}]
commit_message:
make registering a cli opt on a filter object work.

Change the behaviour of ConfigFilter.register_cli_opt to:

1. If the opt is already registered before parsing, then registering
just import it.
2. if the opt is not registered before, then raise an exception named

CliOptRegisteredError.
By adding this modification, the behaviour of
ConfigFilter.register_cli_opt looks more consistent to
ConfigOpts.register_cli_opt. The solution to the question mentioned in
Bug#1366946 should be like this:

from oslo_config import cfg
from oslo_config import cfgfilter

import sys

c = cfg.CONF
c.register_cli_opt(
cfg.BoolOpt('myflag',
default=False,
help='turn on myflag',
)
)
c(sys.argv[1:])

f = cfgfilter.ConfigFilter(c)
f.register_cli_opt(
cfg.BoolOpt('myflag',
default=False,
help='turn on myflag',
)
)

print f.myflag

Closes-Bug: #1366946
Change-Id: I94df9409f72807461370b4aaf8eb2543c52a89bb

subject: timeutils: utcnow() can return a value with a timezone
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-05-22 18:43:17.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_utils/timeutils.py', 'tests/test_timeutils.py'], 'message': "timeutils: utcnow() can return a value with a timezone

utcnow() used to return a non-timezone-aware timezone, which is terrible
as there is then no way to know if it's a local time object or a UTC
time zone object. This patch changes utcnow() so it can carry that
information in the datetime object.

Change-Id: Ib098ef16063d97e37ff2b9a0fc934f67fd9ed5f3
"}]
commit_message:
timeutils: utcnow() can return a value with a timezone

utcnow() used to return a non-timezone-aware timezone, which is terrible
as there is then no way to know if it's a local time object or a UTC
time zone object. This patch changes utcnow() so it can carry that
information in the datetime object.

Change-Id: Ib098ef16063d97e37ff2b9a0fc934f67fd9ed5f3

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-05-21 22:39:30.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py', 'oslo_log/handlers.py', 'requirements.txt', 'oslo_log/log.py'], 'message': 'Replace RFCSysLogHandler by a syslog() based one

Rather than using the Python provided logging module that reimplents the
whole syslog protocol and pointing it to /dev/log (which is not
portable), we use the system calls from the syslog module, which are
portable and default to the behaviour we actually want.

Closes-Bug: 1385295
Closes-Bug: 1391428

Change-Id: I39a36316bd8778831b1bd5e7c5e2e12ede062a37
'}]
commit_message:
Replace RFCSysLogHandler by a syslog() based one

Rather than using the Python provided logging module that reimplents the
whole syslog protocol and pointing it to /dev/log (which is not
portable), we use the system calls from the syslog module, which are
portable and default to the behaviour we actually want.

Closes-Bug: 1385295
Closes-Bug: 1391428

Change-Id: I39a36316bd8778831b1bd5e7c5e2e12ede062a37

subject: Improve logging to debug invalid "extra_specs" entries
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-15 13:30:25.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/scheduler/filters/capabilities_filter.py'], 'message': 'Improve logging to debug invalid "extra_specs" entries

When volume creation fails due to invalid extra_specs entry, its hard
to find a mismatch between extra_specs and capabilities exposed by
multiple hosts. This additional log printings will help to detect a root
cause of the failure.

Change-Id: Ibca56c8ad4cc473ad35f1c79e9892acbf08bf5f1'}]
commit_message:
Improve logging to debug invalid "extra_specs" entries

When volume creation fails due to invalid extra_specs entry, its hard
to find a mismatch between extra_specs and capabilities exposed by
multiple hosts. This additional log printings will help to detect a root
cause of the failure.

Change-Id: Ibca56c8ad4cc473ad35f1c79e9892acbf08bf5f1

commit_message:
Switch from MySQL-python to PyMySQL

As discussed in the Liberty Design Summit "Moving apps to Python 3"
cross-project workshop, the way forward in the near future is to
switch to the pure-python PyMySQL library as a default.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-cross-project-python3

commit_message:
Drop explicit suds dependency

we should just use what oslo.vmware requires. Transitive
dependency should be enough for Nova.

Remove a few imports in a test case to pass the nova
policy of "if any explicit import then need an entry
in requirements".

Also remove tests relating to suds as oslo.vmware uses
suds and any of these tests should be there instead.

Co-Authored-By: Victor Stinner <vstinner@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I28f29d3e5745c21b99dc0cf9eb0cfe4f95dffd17

subject: Do not crash on homedir mkdir
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-14 15:42:07.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/shell.py'], 'message': "Do not crash on homedir mkdir

Glanceclient is trying to create ~/.glanceclient, and crashes if it can't
do that. In some environment (for example, when building the package
under Jenkins), writing on $HOME is simply not allowed, and Glanceclient
can simply ignore it. This patch allows the mkdir() to fail, which fixes
the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1446096
Change-Id: Ib3591fb4e54ccd2fe63a1a4815551ac10ef5b961
"}]
commit_message:
Do not crash on homedir mkdir

Glanceclient is trying to create ~/.glanceclient, and crashes if it can't
do that. In some environment (for example, when building the package
under Jenkins), writing on $HOME is simply not allowed, and Glanceclient
can simply ignore it. This patch allows the mkdir() to fail, which fixes
the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1446096
Change-Id: Ib3591fb4e54ccd2fe63a1a4815551ac10ef5b961

commit_message:
Make setup.py --help-commands work without testrepository

testr command is registered by pbr.hooks.commands if
testrepository is installed, so there is no need to
setup the entry point in setup.cfg.

The PowerVM API introduced a new parameter to determine the management
partition.  This should be excluded from the operations for VMs.  This
change set updates the nova code such that it excludes that partition

Change-Id: I800e0df774403ebc62ad8a5c5df0e77bb0017b25

commit_message:
Update LPAR feed to exclude mgmt partition

The PowerVM API introduced a new parameter to determine the management
partition.  This should be excluded from the operations for VMs.  This
change set updates the nova code such that it excludes that partition
from VM feeds.

Change-Id: I800e0df774403ebc62ad8a5c5df0e77bb0017b25

commit_message:
Bring Redhat support to acceptance tests

OpenStack Infra has jobs to run this on both Ubuntu Trusty and CentOS7.

* Add minitest to Gemfile (dependency to run beaker on centos - see
  http://projects.theforeman.org/issues/2650 for details)
* separate nodepool files to have trusty & centos7 support in OS infra
* basic_swift_spec: add case for repo configuration and support
  RH systems.

Change-Id: I745fa76b2b36b0dbada83260fedffc4ee60f9c03
Closes-bug: #1444736

commit_message:
Ignore lint quoted boolean warning

The $::selinux global comes from factor, and gets stringified with
Puppet 3.x.  Because of this we want to suppress the lint warning since
it's actually what we want to do.

Change-Id: Id18a027c8bda8ae465cbcd9517ea79e07a868bf8

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-03-11 15:15:14.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/v2/shell.py', 'tests/v2/test_shell_v2.py'], 'message': "Remove updated property check from V2

When updating an image using V2 the client checks whether a property is
being changed, if the property is not being changed the the client won't
send it to glance. The server then doesn't raise reserved properties
errors because it won't get the update for that property. It should
be up to the server to check whether the properties from an updated
image have changed.

Fixes-bug: #1307412

Change-Id: Ia4b2d791926c77b20deacc22cf59f3af00f7407b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove updated property check from V2

When updating an image using V2 the client checks whether a property is
being changed, if the property is not being changed the the client won't
send it to glance. The server then doesn't raise reserved properties
errors because it won't get the update for that property. It should
be up to the server to check whether the properties from an updated
image have changed.

Fixes-bug: #1307412

Change-Id: Ia4b2d791926c77b20deacc22cf59f3af00f7407b

commit_message:
GlusterFS: Renaming test case to test_mount_glusterfs

With the patch [1], GlusterFS is now using mount method in
RemoteFsClient. That method mounts a gluster share only if it has
not already been mounted.

So, having test case name as
test_mount_glusterfs_should_mount_correctly, doesn't make sense now.
This patch changes its name to 'test_mount_glusterfs'.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/165424/

Change-Id: I33c16a8315a11fc16ab478d667490f3f73002ee8
