commit_message:
Add hacking rule to detect Python 3 compat issues

Detect the following patterns which are not compatible with Python 3:

* d.iteritems()
* d.iterkeys()
* d.itervalues()

Explicitly ignore files using SQLAlchemy objects because these objects
only have an iteritems() method, no items() method. six.iteritems() must
not be used in these files.

This patch is based on Icc3875d6bf97ab10011c17c89244564045efc759
written by Cyril Roelandt.

Co-Authored-By: Cyril Roelandt <cyril.roelandt@enovance.com>
Blueprint nova-python3
Depends-on: I81465661cb8a74778d70ba9b6641073f1effa49b
Depends-on: Ifd455e70002eb9636b87f83788384127ba6edeeb
Depends-on: I140f499d2054bb7d5486e4c61a2f886be6649cbb
Change-Id: Ic982d114bb4db0f3e197807a12f30b449a6f4573

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-21 21:56:29.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/hacking/checks.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Remove use of contextlib.nested

Removed use of contextlib.nested call from codebase, as it has been
deprecated since Python 2.7.

There are also known issues with contextlib.nested that were addressed
by the native support for multiple "with" variables. For instance, if
the first object is created but the second one throws an exception,
the first object's __exit__ is never called. For more information see
https://docs.python.org/2/library/contextlib.html#contextlib.nested
contextlib.nested is also not compatible with Python 3.

Multi-patch set for easier chunks. This one addresses the
neutron/plugins/ml2 directory.

Line continuation markers (e.g. '\') had to be used or syntax
errors were thrown. While using parentheses is the preferred way
for multiple line statements, but in case of long with statements
backslashes are acceptable.

Partial-Bug: 1428424
Change-Id: I7bbe4cec511125b4b2c954aa93e2d9ff6871b9e0
'}]
commit_message:
Remove use of contextlib.nested

Removed use of contextlib.nested call from codebase, as it has been
deprecated since Python 2.7.

There are also known issues with contextlib.nested that were addressed
by the native support for multiple "with" variables. For instance, if
the first object is created but the second one throws an exception,
the first object's __exit__ is never called. For more information see
https://docs.python.org/2/library/contextlib.html#contextlib.nested
contextlib.nested is also not compatible with Python 3.

Multi-patch set for easier chunks. This one addresses the
neutron/plugins/ml2 directory.

Line continuation markers (e.g. '\') had to be used or syntax
errors were thrown. While using parentheses is the preferred way
for multiple line statements, but in case of long with statements
backslashes are acceptable.

Partial-Bug: 1428424
Change-Id: I7bbe4cec511125b4b2c954aa93e2d9ff6871b9e0

commit_message:
WIP: Object pinning

Do not merge.  This is a PoC to demonstrate how to pin objects
to a given milestone version, so that it can be converted to the
correct object version before it is sent over RPC.  This PoC
uses the Snapshot object as an example, since it is the most
complete so far.

Change-Id: Id5e0c9551b34a9a1374e69e1e17a1ee25e218cd4

commit_message:
IPAM reference driver

An alternate pluggable IPAM implementation from the built-in one
in db_base_plugin_v2.
Modifies IPAM interface to allow passing context to driver and
introduces new interface method 'associate_neutron_subnet'.

Implements blueprint reference-ipam-driver

Change-Id: I2e1e9fc7994bf1157bcd34b7ea500eb30c61d9ab

commit_message:
Use namespace names in NetcatTester

Currently NetcatTester requests namespace IPWrapper instances as
client/server_namespace arguments but functional tests commonly use
namespace names as arguments not IPWrapper instances (because IPWrapper
is cheap to instantiate) and NetcatTester needs only namespace names.

This change requests names as NetcatTester client/server_namespace
arguments in order to simplify NetcatTester and its use.

Change-Id: Ic4a297efdeaef00e70892d1c871ce1c9174055b8

subject: Handle http response code 404 properly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-22 13:21:56.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/benchmark/test_utils.py', 'rally/benchmark/utils.py'], 'message': 'Handle http response code 404 properly

Any operation "wait_for_delete" expects that exception with http code "404"
will be raised.
Different python clients return this code with different names of attribute -
either "code" or "http_status".
But function "rally/benchmark/utils.py:get_from_manager" does not expect
the latter case and raises general exception "exceptions.GetResourceFailure"
instead of expected "exceptions.GetResourceNotFound".
So, fix mentioned function and related unit test that was asserting
wrong thing.

Change-Id: I0430ed8a3e9308e8f4a245b4c68e8d7f1f0bd02d
Closes-Bug: #1457882
'}]
commit_message:
Handle http response code 404 properly

Any operation "wait_for_delete" expects that exception with http code "404"
will be raised.
Different python clients return this code with different names of attribute -
either "code" or "http_status".
But function "rally/benchmark/utils.py:get_from_manager" does not expect
the latter case and raises general exception "exceptions.GetResourceFailure"
instead of expected "exceptions.GetResourceNotFound".
So, fix mentioned function and related unit test that was asserting
wrong thing.

Change-Id: I0430ed8a3e9308e8f4a245b4c68e8d7f1f0bd02d
Closes-Bug: #1457882

commit_message:
Fix ordering for enable-cinder task

  Enable_cinder.pp manifests requires cinder-volume
  package to be installed. So, this manifests should
  be run only after cinder modular script.

  Closes-bug: #1457939

Change-Id: Id51e4d917378f94b998b952deeaf14aa5623123e

subject: Pass requested networks to scheduler filter_props
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3217, 'name': 'Ian Wells', 'username': 'ijw-ubuntu'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7166, 'name': 'Sylvain Bauza', 'email': 'sbauza@redhat.com', 'username': 'sbauza'}, {'_account_id': 7664, 'name': 'Joe Cropper', 'email': 'jwcroppe@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'jwcroppe'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16391, 'name': 'Stephen Pierce', 'email': 'pierce_stephen@hotmail.com', 'username': 'spierce'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-18 14:46:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py'], 'message': "Pass requested networks to scheduler filter_props

In Icehouse, the nova-scheduler still had a primary responsibility
in orchestrating a VM's deployment and, as such, had access to the
requested_networks via the schedule_run_instance(...) method. In Juno,
we've switched to a model in which the conductor takes over more of
this capability and only invokes the scheduler's select_destination
method.

As a result, the scheduler no longer has any way to determine
which networks are being requested, leaving schedulers unable to
determine which networks the user is requesting at deploy time since
there are no other associations formed at this time.

This patch sends the requested_networks along to the scheduler's
select_destinations() method via filter_props['requested_networks'],
thus allowing schedulers to interrogate this information at VM
initial deploy time.

Change-Id: I8d85a8aaffe4a68a9b8328931535b3ac2bfaf19a
Closes-Bug: #1363568
"}]
commit_message:
Pass requested networks to scheduler filter_props

In Icehouse, the nova-scheduler still had a primary responsibility
in orchestrating a VM's deployment and, as such, had access to the
requested_networks via the schedule_run_instance(...) method. In Juno,
we've switched to a model in which the conductor takes over more of
this capability and only invokes the scheduler's select_destination
method.

As a result, the scheduler no longer has any way to determine
which networks are being requested, leaving schedulers unable to
determine which networks the user is requesting at deploy time since
there are no other associations formed at this time.

This patch sends the requested_networks along to the scheduler's
select_destinations() method via filter_props['requested_networks'],
thus allowing schedulers to interrogate this information at VM
initial deploy time.

Change-Id: I8d85a8aaffe4a68a9b8328931535b3ac2bfaf19a
Closes-Bug: #1363568

commit_message:
make it possible to import amqp driver without dependencies

All plugins are supposed to be importable without their dependencies so
we can discover options and documentation. Restructure the parts of the
AMQP1 driver that depend on having proton and pyngus installed so the
driver can load without them.

Change-Id: Id0c8c2a6ae44d13f061e651c33efc9e38750a049

commit_message:
Keep py3.X compatibility for urllib

Use six.moves.urllib.parse instead of urllib.
For urllib2 compatibility, it need to sync policy
module from oslo first. Then six.moves.urllib.request
can replace urllib2.

Partial-Bug: #1280105

Change-Id: Ic3fade153c4453e340a0d6ca7f7f9eb742284543

subject: Simplify request making in auth_token tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-04 02:50:15.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/auth_token/test_auth_token_middleware.py', 'keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/auth_token/base.py'], 'message': "Simplify request making in auth_token tests

One of the reasons that there are so many unrelated tests in the basic
test_auth_token_middleware tests file is that there is a lot of token
and mocking setup that is required for all tests.

Firstly extract a base class with some middleware creation helpers. Use
these in the existing tests. Remove the concept of start_request. webob
has helpers that can simplify this into the standard request/response
handling so there is no reason we need this and we don't want to copy it
to new test files.

Change-Id: I31bb40feb1915b75193eac621be5501dde162f08
"}]
commit_message:
Simplify request making in auth_token tests

One of the reasons that there are so many unrelated tests in the basic
test_auth_token_middleware tests file is that there is a lot of token
and mocking setup that is required for all tests.

Firstly extract a base class with some middleware creation helpers. Use
these in the existing tests. Remove the concept of start_request. webob
has helpers that can simplify this into the standard request/response
handling so there is no reason we need this and we don't want to copy it
to new test files.

Change-Id: I31bb40feb1915b75193eac621be5501dde162f08

commit_message:
Move remaining schema files into v2_1 directory

After removing v3 schemas, we have only 1 set of schemas for v2 (/v2.1)
APIs but those end up in scattered structure.

Schema files needs to be re arranged into a clean structure. Any
resource schema should be defined in single file for better readability.

This patch move remaining schema files into v2_1 directory and rename
some schemas according to their API.

Partially implements blueprint rearrange-nova-response-schemas

Change-Id: If07f0a929c7085090bcefd4d2d565b896bf438f3

subject: Favor the use of importlib over Python internal __import__ statement
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-21 07:52:41.000000000', 'files': ['congressclient/common/utils.py'], 'message': 'Favor the use of importlib over Python internal __import__ statement

From the Python documentation, we have:

Because this function is meant for use by the Python interpreter and
not for general use it is better to use importlib.import_module() to
programmatically import a module.

This change implements exactly what the Python documentation, and
recognized best practices, recommend.

Also, move import_class utility function before its used in
get_client_class. Even though there are no behaviour differences
because of the order of definition of functions within the same Python
module, it helps users when reading the code.

Change-Id: I85e769e3ac108575a97351780bf0f5b3ef59cfb2
Signed-off-by: Cleber Rosa <cleber.gnu@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Favor the use of importlib over Python internal __import__ statement

From the Python documentation, we have:

Because this function is meant for use by the Python interpreter and
not for general use it is better to use importlib.import_module() to
programmatically import a module.

This change implements exactly what the Python documentation, and
recognized best practices, recommend.

Also, move import_class utility function before its used in
get_client_class. Even though there are no behaviour differences
because of the order of definition of functions within the same Python
module, it helps users when reading the code.

Change-Id: I85e769e3ac108575a97351780bf0f5b3ef59cfb2
Signed-off-by: Cleber Rosa <cleber.gnu@gmail.com>

useful to get a list of all the plugins that are installed on the
system. Provide a version that returns the classes as well so that you

Change-Id: I021249eac8156c2d3ccbbacb7503184b6eb6e784

commit_message:
Provide a means to get all installed plugins

Particular for use in writing error messages and help text it can be
useful to get a list of all the plugins that are installed on the
system. Provide a version that returns the classes as well so that you
don't have to reload the modules if the user is picking one.

Closes-Bug: #1423711
Change-Id: I021249eac8156c2d3ccbbacb7503184b6eb6e784

Change-Id: I0bb0f2b591c402202104af8daf07d56b514cbb2f

commit_message:
Fix list_opts test to not check all deps

The list_opts entrypoint test failed unnecessarily when the
dependencies in the packages were inconsistent. This test doesn't
need to verify that the dependencies are consistent, only that the
entrypoint is available and provides the expected function.

Change-Id: I0bb0f2b591c402202104af8daf07d56b514cbb2f

If someone choses a string length of over 255 we overflow the DB
id field causing an error, so instead use the physical name
for the resource_id.

The actual string is already stored (encrypted) in the resource_data
so it's probably better anyway to refer to the value in one place
and just override FnGetRefId to maintain the existing interface behavior.

(Combined cherry-pick from Ide8899a2aa0a9fed037835dc46225f52c291ace6
 and I233476b8411612350c884c4480a8e2f5cc8c2ab5)

Change-Id: I0c55f1fa026de20b096b845e21095e91ac6bf166
Closes-Bug: #1392359
"}]
commit_message:
RandomString physical_resource_id as id not the string

If someone choses a string length of over 255 we overflow the DB
id field causing an error, so instead use the physical name
for the resource_id.

The actual string is already stored (encrypted) in the resource_data
so it's probably better anyway to refer to the value in one place
and just override FnGetRefId to maintain the existing interface behavior.

(Combined cherry-pick from Ide8899a2aa0a9fed037835dc46225f52c291ace6
 and I233476b8411612350c884c4480a8e2f5cc8c2ab5)

Change-Id: I0c55f1fa026de20b096b845e21095e91ac6bf166
Closes-Bug: #1392359

commit_message:
Merge user_data functional tests of v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges user_data functional tests.

Change-Id: I31aeb01864c9e67e0bc20f2ba3b1a8bf01e8104d

commit_message:
Replace dict.iteritems() with six.iteritems(dict)

This patch was generated by the sixer tool version 0.2 using the
"iteritems" operation:
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/sixer

Manual changes:

- Don't change get_instance_metadata() in nova/compute/api.py:
  fixed by the change Ifd455e70002eb9636b87f83788384127ba6edeeb.
- Don't change sqlalchemy code and
  nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py. sqlalchemy objects cannot be
  converted to a dictionary using dict(obj) directly yet. It will be
  possible with the change I702be362a58155a28482e733e60539d36c039509.
- Revert change in a comment in nova/objects/instance.py; the sixer tool
  is limited and don't understand comments
- Reformat nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py to respect the 80 columns
  contraint

Blueprint nova-python3
Change-Id: I81465661cb8a74778d70ba9b6641073f1effa49b

commit_message:
Remove commented out logging statement

Commit e4d43e0b completed the implementation of a functional DSE,
policy and data sources. This commit removed logging statements used
for debugging, but there was a leftover.

Let's remove it for good.

Closes-Bug: 1455988
Change-Id: I476e148d29b54cbe8251a855988182a86e0e1782
Signed-off-by: Cleber Rosa <cleber.gnu@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Expose Puppet OpenStack specs to specs.openstack.org

Puppet OpenStack specs are being refactorized to be consistent with
OpenStack projects (example taken with Ceilometer, Telemetry specs).
The goal is to expose the blueprints on specs.openstack.org.

See also https://review.openstack.org/#/c/184943/

Change-Id: I79da2cb55ae6b1849001fe05f96c4ed35351c356
Depends-on: I90b0b37d0fa00f299e7bd96be1f75645afe87ac6

subject: Unused pretty printer cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-05-21 07:55:29.000000000', 'files': ['congress/dse/amqprouter.py'], 'message': 'Unused pretty printer cleanup

The ampqrouter in its most basic data structure, Node, adds a pretty
printer that for as much as I investigated, has no real use
whatsoever.

Besides cleaning up the code this should also slightly improve the
performance every time a Node class is instantiated.

Closes-Bug: 1456729
Change-Id: Ic8e6a9523f76d0cd5bfc7cfe816fb43884fbdf5d
Signed-off-by: Cleber Rosa <cleber.gnu@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Unused pretty printer cleanup

The ampqrouter in its most basic data structure, Node, adds a pretty
printer that for as much as I investigated, has no real use
whatsoever.

Besides cleaning up the code this should also slightly improve the
performance every time a Node class is instantiated.

Closes-Bug: 1456729
Change-Id: Ic8e6a9523f76d0cd5bfc7cfe816fb43884fbdf5d

subject: Add action execution for murano driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-05 15:53:37.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/datasources/test_murano_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/murano_driver.py'], 'message': 'Add action execution for murano driver

Murano predefined actions are embedded in packages that used
for service deployment. And action information is available
in service json.  Therefore the action info is populated to
tables [when translating services] and the action tables
are referenced when executed. This is different from the
way other drivers use the action where the users specify
an action in the format, e.g. nova_datasource:pause_vm(args).
Murano action will have the format
murano_datasource:muranoaction(env_id, obj_id, actionName).

Implements: blueprint murano-driver

Change-Id: Ic320a4ce0ce895ba5a5b8867c2f07ec8cd948d8e
'}]
commit_message:
Add action execution for murano driver

Murano predefined actions are embedded in packages that used
for service deployment. And action information is available
in service json.  Therefore the action info is populated to
tables [when translating services] and the action tables
are referenced when executed. This is different from the
way other drivers use the action where the users specify
an action in the format, e.g. nova_datasource:pause_vm(args).
Murano action will have the format
murano_datasource:muranoaction(env_id, obj_id, actionName).

Implements: blueprint murano-driver

Change-Id: Ic320a4ce0ce895ba5a5b8867c2f07ec8cd948d8e

subject: Fix VM-placement engine error on host names with dashes
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-05-13 21:05:05.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/policy_engines/test_vmplacement.py', 'congress/policy_engines/vm_placement.py'], 'message': 'Fix VM-placement engine error on host names with dashes

Previously, if the name of a VM-placement engine contained a dash or an
underscore, the VM-placement engine would fail to properly invoke the
LP solver to find a new guest-host assignment.  This happened because
the code assumed all the assignment variables were of the form
"assign_<guest>_<host>".  This is problematic if the <guest> or
<host> contain an underscore, and it is even problematic if they
contain a dash since PuLP converts dashes to underscores.

This fix introduces a level of indirection so that <guest> and <host>
are always integers that map to the original <guest> and <host>.
In fact, all arguments to LP variables are now integers that map
to the original values.

Change-Id: I63808ef6411f10d2d462f60093650ae93253a585
'}]
commit_message:
Fix VM-placement engine error on host names with dashes

Previously, if the name of a VM-placement engine contained a dash or an
underscore, the VM-placement engine would fail to properly invoke the
LP solver to find a new guest-host assignment.  This happened because
the code assumed all the assignment variables were of the form
"assign_<guest>_<host>".  This is problematic if the <guest> or
<host> contain an underscore, and it is even problematic if they
contain a dash since PuLP converts dashes to underscores.

This fix introduces a level of indirection so that <guest> and <host>
are always integers that map to the original <guest> and <host>.
In fact, all arguments to LP variables are now integers that map
to the original values.

Change-Id: I63808ef6411f10d2d462f60093650ae93253a585

subject: Fixed bug in negation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 18:37:07.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datalog/topdown.py', 'congress/tests/datalog/test_nonrecur.py'], 'message': 'Fixed bug in negation

Negation code was assuming the return value of top_down_eval
told us whether the proof attempt succeeded, when in reality
it was returning whether or not the search was finished.
It so happens that within negation the two answers are the
same, but it is confusing.

Change-Id: I4affe697ed8924b818dfc87b05764adddd060412
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed bug in negation

Negation code was assuming the return value of top_down_eval
told us whether the proof attempt succeeded, when in reality
it was returning whether or not the search was finished.
It so happens that within negation the two answers are the
same, but it is confusing.

Change-Id: I4affe697ed8924b818dfc87b05764adddd060412

subject: Deal with PEP-0476 certificate chaining checking
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-30 12:29:05.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/test_ssl.py'], 'message': 'Deal with PEP-0476 certificate chaining checking

PEP-0476 introduced more thorough certificate chain verification
for HTTPS connectivity; this was introduced in Python 2.7.9, and
breaks a number of unit tests in the keystone codebase.

Disable certificate chain verification for keystone SSL tests
using the backwards compatible SSLContext provided for this
purpose.

Closes-Bug: #1403068
(cherry picked from commit 89aec92962a551dc06520e284dadc63a0a58ad2c)

Conflicts:
	keystone/tests/test_ssl.py

Change-Id: I6b5e975ed4c9abf3571212ba0e172eb653bb9281
'}]
commit_message:
Deal with PEP-0476 certificate chaining checking

PEP-0476 introduced more thorough certificate chain verification
for HTTPS connectivity; this was introduced in Python 2.7.9, and
breaks a number of unit tests in the keystone codebase.

Disable certificate chain verification for keystone SSL tests
using the backwards compatible SSLContext provided for this
purpose.

Closes-Bug: #1403068
(cherry picked from commit 89aec92962a551dc06520e284dadc63a0a58ad2c)

Conflicts:
	keystone/tests/test_ssl.py

Change-Id: I6b5e975ed4c9abf3571212ba0e172eb653bb9281

commit_message:
Make sure LDAP filter is constructed correctly

This fixes an issue where, when querying Keystone via the v3 API, you
would get back an invalid LDAP filter, because None was coerced to the
string "None" and inserted into the middle of the query.

Change-Id: I9d45a4dca265b69e261f134118bb30c8cd128166
Closes-Bug: 1454309

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-05-12 09:55:52.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/identity/v3/role.py', 'openstackclient/identity/common.py', 'doc/source/command-objects/role.rst'], 'message': 'Enable specifing domains in "role add"

If users, projects or groups are provided by name, there is a
possibility of the existence other users/projects/groups with the same
name in other domain.  Even though this is not a problem if the actual
ID is given instead of a name; this is mostly a usability enhancement.

So, three options were added, one for specifying the domain where the
user belongs, another one to specify the project's domain, and finally
one to specify the group's domain.

Change-Id: Iab04b0e04fa75ea5aa3723b8ea42a45f58a6cdb2
Closes-Bug: #1421328
'}]
commit_message:
Enable specifing domains in "role add"

If users, projects or groups are provided by name, there is a
possibility of the existence other users/projects/groups with the same
name in other domain.  Even though this is not a problem if the actual
ID is given instead of a name; this is mostly a usability enhancement.

So, three options were added, one for specifying the domain where the
user belongs, another one to specify the project's domain, and finally
one to specify the group's domain.

Change-Id: Iab04b0e04fa75ea5aa3723b8ea42a45f58a6cdb2
Closes-Bug: #1421328

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 8736, 'name': 'Terry Howe', 'email': 'terrylhowe@gmail.com', 'username': 'terrylhowe'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-05-17 14:52:10.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'Fix insecure/verify options

The insecure and verify options are broken so that verify always
gets set to True.  One problem was that the parsed args not
defaulted so os_cloud_config thinks there was always a command
line specified.  The other problem was getattr was called on cloud
config instead of get.

Closes-Bug: #1450855
Change-Id: Ib5f004f51a7453cc8f5a89759e2031ec42e04a30
'}]
commit_message:
Fix insecure/verify options

The insecure and verify options are broken so that verify always
gets set to True.  One problem was that the parsed args not
defaulted so os_cloud_config thinks there was always a command
line specified.  The other problem was getattr was called on cloud
config instead of get.

Closes-Bug: #1450855
Change-Id: Ib5f004f51a7453cc8f5a89759e2031ec42e04a30

commit_message:
Python 3: encode to UTF-8 when needed

* hmac.new() and hashlib.md5() expect bytes: encode unicode strings to
  UTF-8
* fileutils.write_to_tempfile() expects bytes for content: encode YAML
  to UTF-8 on Python 3

Change-Id: If7a2513632e24e0c6d3c544a1de81fdc9004e2aa

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-05-13 02:04:49.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/auth_token/test_auth_token_middleware.py', 'keystonemiddleware/auth_token/_cache.py', 'keystonemiddleware/auth_token/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Cleanup token hashes generated by cache

We hash a token under multiple configurable algorithms for revocations
and caching and so must check all of them. This hash generation was
being done and returned by the cache check and reused in revocation
check. This is an unusual pattern and requires the cache object to have
knowledge of token types and how to hash them.

Change validate so that we generate the hash values in the main function
and pass that to the cache and revocation functions. This moves the
function to get the first available token id from the list to the main
file. This means the cache interface is much more normal with get and
set id functions and encapsulates the hash list function in the one
file.

Change-Id: I9194dbd052674f64122ff74329ce292a342512d3
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup token hashes generated by cache

We hash a token under multiple configurable algorithms for revocations
and caching and so must check all of them. This hash generation was
being done and returned by the cache check and reused in revocation
check. This is an unusual pattern and requires the cache object to have
knowledge of token types and how to hash them.

Change validate so that we generate the hash values in the main function
and pass that to the cache and revocation functions. This moves the
function to get the first available token id from the list to the main
file. This means the cache interface is much more normal with get and
set id functions and encapsulates the hash list function in the one
file.

Change-Id: I9194dbd052674f64122ff74329ce292a342512d3

subject: Add an explicit test failure condition when auth_token is missing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-22 16:57:05.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/test_opts.py'], 'message': 'Add an explicit test failure condition when auth_token is missing

If the loop exits "successfully" without finding auth_token, scope fall
through would result in 'extension' containing the last iteration of the
'for' loop.

This change results in that behavior explicitly failing with better
error feedback.

Change-Id: Ifa63a78d267e810fcf4adb40524613d7d8f3b5b7
'}]
commit_message:
Add an explicit test failure condition when auth_token is missing

If the loop exits "successfully" without finding auth_token, scope fall
through would result in 'extension' containing the last iteration of the
'for' loop.

This change results in that behavior explicitly failing with better
error feedback.

Change-Id: Ifa63a78d267e810fcf4adb40524613d7d8f3b5b7

Change-Id: Icbd6e4f34ddba107af529634400eb41ad4cb9d38

commit_message:
Fixes health monitor create issues

Queue producer handler was not sending pool_id, it was sending a healthmonitor
id instead, which doesn't exist.  Changed queue consumer and controller worker
to relfect this change as well.  Also had to handle None expected codes better
in jinja config.

Change-Id: Icbd6e4f34ddba107af529634400eb41ad4cb9d38

handle_connect_error() open and return a test connection, but nobody

connection can stay opened in the pool for some time.

commit_message:
Ensure that create_engine() close test connection

handle_connect_error() open and return a test connection, but nobody
uses it in create_engine(), so (depending on Python interpreter) this
connection can stay opened in the pool for some time.

Co-Authored-By: Roman Podoliaka <rpodolyaka@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ibef07f0fa1fec61aa10963c07c410a731d7758ef

commit_message:
Add common pitfalls document

Document describing some of the possible common problems
a user might notice after installing the OVN devstack plugin
and the solution to these problems.

commit_message:
Fix dependency on nova-common package

  Nova module could be not included or imported directly
  and this can lead to failure with missing dependency
  on 'nova-common' package. More safe is to use
  Package <| title == nova-common |>

Change-Id: Idac8d52955ff6f3f1c62a538b197eeac6f281a1f

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-05-22 17:16:06.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/trove_init_spec.rb', 'manifests/params.pp', 'manifests/taskmanager.pp'], 'message': 'CentOS 7 compatibility

This patch fixes:
  - invalid client package name for RH platform
  - missing common package installation in init.pp
  - package/group/directory creation order for CentOS,
    but leaves invalid order for Ubuntu because without
    it is not installable (see bug #1365561)
  - exists_notification_transformer is disabled
    to workaround bug #1402055

Change-Id: I4354fb3a1e3f075070fa492420017b94241b3f60
'}]
commit_message:
CentOS 7 compatibility

This patch fixes:
  - invalid client package name for RH platform
  - missing common package installation in init.pp
  - package/group/directory creation order for CentOS,
    but leaves invalid order for Ubuntu because without
    it is not installable (see bug #1365561)
  - exists_notification_transformer is disabled
    to workaround bug #1402055

Change-Id: I4354fb3a1e3f075070fa492420017b94241b3f60

commit_message:
Bring Redhat support to acceptance tests

OpenStack Infra has jobs to run this on both Ubuntu Trusty and CentOS7.

* Add minitest to Gemfile (dependency to run beaker on centos - see
  http://projects.theforeman.org/issues/2650 for details)
* separate nodepool files to have trusty & centos7 support in OS infra
* basic_sahara_spec: add case for repo configuration and support
  RH systems.

Change-Id: I92aa839e7f3722e89b8582a4f9371c715615690c
Closes-bug: #1444736

commit_message:

OpenStack Infra has jobs to run this on both Ubuntu Trusty and CentOS7.

* Add minitest to Gemfile (dependency to run beaker on centos - see
  http://projects.theforeman.org/issues/2650 for details)
* separate nodepool files to have trusty & centos7 support in OS infra
* basic_trove_spec: add case for repo configuration and support
  RH systems.

commit_message:
Adds ssl_overrides to glance client creation

If3f88d8db4a726219573d0f1b65908408e3aa6a9 added a util method so that
http clients created by nova can have per-client overrides for ssl
options. This patch uses that util method in the glance client.

DocImpact new configuation option CONF.glance.ssl_overrides, as described

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ie03325a902ec882d340f1f1b017da546edb6815d

commit_message:
Adds ssl_overrides dict for keystone client configuration

So that we can allow users to specify different values for
ca_cert, cert and key for each https client which nova creates,
we add an 'ssl_overrides' DictOpt for each one. This patch does
so for the keystone client created in the ec2 api.

DocImpact new config option CONF.ec2_ssl_overrides

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I7222712970e09e2807dc572d1bb922f2b3c4491d

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2015-03-31 10:09:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'nova/utils.py'], 'message': "Adds util method for merging SSL config options

Nova's outbound connections to other services may want to inherit
global ssl config, or may need per-service changes to ca_file,
cert_file and key_file. An ML discussion [1] suggested a way to achieve
this neatly, by allowing global options to be used with a per-client
DictOpt for the overrides.

This util method will be common to all client changes to allow this so
is added by itself first. Follow-up patches for glance, neutron, cinder
and keystone will be added.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-December/052175.html

Change-Id: If3f88d8db4a726219573d0f1b65908408e3aa6a9
"}]
commit_message:
Adds util method for merging SSL config options

Nova's outbound connections to other services may want to inherit
global ssl config, or may need per-service changes to ca_file,
cert_file and key_file. An ML discussion [1] suggested a way to achieve
this neatly, by allowing global options to be used with a per-client
DictOpt for the overrides.

This util method will be common to all client changes to allow this so
is added by itself first. Follow-up patches for glance, neutron, cinder
and keystone will be added.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-December/052175.html

Change-Id: If3f88d8db4a726219573d0f1b65908408e3aa6a9

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-22 06:46:14.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/dev/dev-manual-devstack.rst', 'doc/source/dev/dev-quickstart.rst'], 'message': 'Add more note when play magnum with devstack

* If there is localrc exists, devstack will ignore local.conf.
  Add some note to clarify this.

* Add VOLUME_BACKING_FILE_SIZE=20G when create cinder volume.
  Since when create a default bay, it will require at least 5G * 2
  volume, but the default cinder volume group size is only 10G, even
  it will sitify 5G *2, but I got failed when use default volume group
  size.

* And some other nit fixes.

Change-Id: I24c894d3799ee5aecde551a47c15b6a98546874a
'}]
commit_message:
Add more note when play magnum with devstack

* If there is localrc exists, devstack will ignore local.conf.
  Add some note to clarify this.

* Add VOLUME_BACKING_FILE_SIZE=20G when create cinder volume.
  Since when create a default bay, it will require at least 5G * 2
  volume, but the default cinder volume group size is only 10G, even
  it will sitify 5G *2, but I got failed when use default volume group
  size.

* And some other nit fixes.

commit_message:
Replace dict(obj.iteritems()) with dict(obj)

This change makes the modified code compatible with Python 2 and Python 3.

Add __iter__() and keys() methods to NovaObjectDictCompat. These methods
are added temporarly, the change
I4c52d44c7ba49f98b1bbd123209fce7b70ade98d added these methods to the
base class VersionedObjectDictCompat of oslo.versionedobjects.

sqlalchemy code is unchanged. sqlalchemy objects cannot be converted to
a dictionary using dict(obj) directly yet. It will be possible with the
change I702be362a58155a28482e733e60539d36c039509.

Don't change get_instance_metadata() in nova/compute/api.py, it's
fixed by the change Ifd455e70002eb9636b87f83788384127ba6edeeb.

Blueprint nova-python3
Change-Id: I46e5fcaaef75178fb4db44368e34da8777b4c4b1

commit_message:
Add docstrings for ``protocol`` parameter

Parameter ``protocol`` was missing docstrings in the __init__.
Also, config help is very poor.
This patch fixes both issues.

Change-Id: Ia2cfee9ba6aa5f4ca036c008bcfe03ff9113c7a3

Change-Id: Iceda35cace04cc8ddc6adbd59df4613b22b39793

commit_message:
Use six.moves.range for Python 3

The function xrange() was renamed to range() in Python 3.

Use "from six.moves import range" to get xrange() on Python 2 and range() on
Python 3 as the name "range", and replace "xrange()" with "range()".

The import is omitted for small ranges (1024 items or less).

This patch was generated by the following tool (revision 0c1d096b3903)
with the "xrange" operation:
https://bitbucket.org/haypo/misc/src/tip/python/sixer.py

Manual change:

* Replace range(n) with list(range(n)) in a loop of
  nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py which uses list.pop()

Blueprint nova-python3
Change-Id: Iceda35cace04cc8ddc6adbd59df4613b22b39793

commit_message:
Don't use dict.iterkeys()

Iterating on a dictionary iterators on its keys, so calling its
iterkeys() method is not needed.

Moreover, the dict.iterkeys() method is gone in Python 3. This change
makes the modified code compatible with Python 3.

Blueprint nova-python3
Change-Id: I140f499d2054bb7d5486e4c61a2f886be6649cbb

The novaclient tests are rife with examples of using a list comprehension
to perform a series of asserts, when a simple for loop would be more
appropriate and more idiomatic; part of the problem is the propensity
for people to cut and paste.  Eliminating the existing examples should
remove the temptation for developers to use this non-idiom to perform
tests.

Change-Id: I2cc8979e720740eae81692a60e30a3d95dce2a2c
'}]
commit_message:
Eliminate test comprehensions

The novaclient tests are rife with examples of using a list comprehension
to perform a series of asserts, when a simple for loop would be more
appropriate and more idiomatic; part of the problem is the propensity
for people to cut and paste.  Eliminating the existing examples should
remove the temptation for developers to use this non-idiom to perform
tests.

Change-Id: I2cc8979e720740eae81692a60e30a3d95dce2a2c

commit_message:
Fix LUN misalignment issue with NetApp iSCSI drivers

This patch fixes LUN misalignment issues that can be
experienced when provisioning Cinder volumes with the iSCSI
protocol. In the fix, two new SAN options for configuring
LUN OS and initiator OS used while attaching volume can be
specified. This gives the admin flexibility to configure
backends correctly for multiple hypervisor and guest OS
platforms.

Closes-Bug: 1410107

Change-Id: If09e1ad41880e8070afddde5606c6536b03396fe
(cherry picked from commit 614c82fe160d8e776cd6acc6f6f1b12c63ddfb0f)

OpenStack Infra has jobs to run this on both Ubuntu Trusty and CentOS7.

* Add minitest to Gemfile (dependency to run beaker on centos - see
  http://projects.theforeman.org/issues/2650 for details)
* separate nodepool files to have trusty & centos7 support in OS infra

commit_message:
Bring Redhat support to acceptance tests

OpenStack Infra has jobs to run this on both Ubuntu Trusty and CentOS7.

* Add minitest to Gemfile (dependency to run beaker on centos - see
  http://projects.theforeman.org/issues/2650 for details)
* separate nodepool files to have trusty & centos7 support in OS infra
* rabbitmq_spec: add support for RH systems.
* mysql_spec: removed .my.cnf dependency

Change-Id: Ic4864e6e1a23a09057a332b6b6536e4ef4e3af00
Closes-bug: #1444736

commit_message:
Fix list_opts test to not check all deps

The list_opts entrypoint test failed unnecessarily when the
dependencies in the packages were inconsistent. This test doesn't
need to verify that the dependencies are consistent, only that the
entrypoint is available and provides the expected function.

Change-Id: I857222e0637b09f45352d9cabbdc5cac8e4fd562

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-22 08:58:29.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': 'Fix rabbit OCF reset_mnesia

W/o this fix, when rabbit app cannot start due to
corrupted mnesia state, the mnesia would be cleaned
not completely. This may prevent the rabbit app from
start and take the node out of the cluster permanently.

The solution is to remove all rabbit node related mnesia
files.

Closes-bug: #1457766

Change-Id: I680efbf573c22aa9a13d8429d985b5a57235b2bf
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rabbit OCF reset_mnesia

W/o this fix, when rabbit app cannot start due to
corrupted mnesia state, the mnesia would be cleaned
not completely. This may prevent the rabbit app from
start and take the node out of the cluster permanently.

The solution is to remove all rabbit node related mnesia
files.

Closes-bug: #1457766

Change-Id: I680efbf573c22aa9a13d8429d985b5a57235b2bf
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Bring Redhat support to acceptance tests

OpenStack Infra has jobs to run this on both Ubuntu Trusty and
OS7.

* Add minitest to Gemfile (dependency to run beaker on centos - see
  http://projects.theforeman.org/issues/2650 for details)
* separate nodepool files to have trusty & centos7 support in OS
* include apt module for Debian/Ubuntu
* configure RabbitMQ with the good provider

Change-Id: I696f147ab55ef0bed1d20f0bca468c8c78d5886c
Closes-bug: #1444736

Provide a default policy which requires to be admin for every API call except
rating/quote, report/total and storage/list_data_frames (which will require a
bit more control to return only the current tenant data for non-admin users).

Also provide a custom Context class to extract roles information from the API

commit_message:
Enforce a default policy

Provide a default policy which requires to be admin for every API call except
rating/quote, report/total and storage/list_data_frames (which will require a
bit more control to return only the current tenant data for non-admin users).

Also provide a custom Context class to extract roles information from the API
request.

hashmap controllers now use a new base class which provides a custom
_route method. This will avoid to define policies for core and external
configuration APIs.

Change-Id: Ie3feb4e926270b95ab813a5d24854d1df1758a5e

commit_message:
Sync rabbit OCF code diverge to packages

W/o this patch, the code in OCF script from
deployment/ dir will never get to the fuel-library
packages, which are building from files/ and /debian
dirs only.

The solution is:
1) sync the code diverged to the files/ and debian/
2) either to remove the source OCF file or to
update the way files being linked.

This patch fixes only the step 1 as there is not yet
decided how to deal with the step 2.

Related-bug: #1457441
Related-bug: #184966

Change-Id: Ied86640e8e853de99bcd26f1ae726fc8272b6db7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Bring Redhat support to acceptance tests

OpenStack Infra has jobs to run this on both Ubuntu Trusty and CentOS7.

* Add minitest to Gemfile (dependency to run beaker on centos - see
  http://projects.theforeman.org/issues/2650 for details)
* separate nodepool files to have trusty & centos7 support in OS infra

Change-Id: I3470c38ac7598d4444dd79d9e7642d9321ff7fc6
Closes-bug: #1444736

Replaces the usage of ovs_neutron_agent.LocalVLANMapping with
a named tuple, making the l2pop unit tests independent from OVS.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-15 18:38:26.000000000', 'files': ['Vagrantfile', 'vagrant.yml'], 'message': 'Slight changes to Vagrant developer configs

This makes two changes to the Vagrant defaults for the developer VM:
- Lowers VM memory from 2048 to 512, and pins the VM to 25% of one CPU
  core. This is helpful for low-power development environments (like
  laptops) and is sufficient for RabbitMQ and MySQL.
- Changes the default set of hardware drivers to be a minimal set
  for developer environments that do not require the installation
  of any hardware-specific utilities or libraries.
  This list is: pxe_ssh, agent_ssh, fake

Change-Id: Icb5e0e42a07386b93250f8fa461424b69c7cdee9
'}]
commit_message:
Slight changes to Vagrant developer configs

This makes two changes to the Vagrant defaults for the developer VM:
- Lowers VM memory from 2048 to 512, and pins the VM to 25% of one CPU
  core. This is helpful for low-power development environments (like
  laptops) and is sufficient for RabbitMQ and MySQL.
- Changes the default set of hardware drivers to be a minimal set
  for developer environments that do not require the installation
  of any hardware-specific utilities or libraries.
  This list is: pxe_ssh, agent_ssh, fake

Change-Id: Icb5e0e42a07386b93250f8fa461424b69c7cdee9

commit_message:
Allow list_services to be filtered by host

We would like to use heatclient's service-list to monitor engine status,
however the returned list currently cannot be filtered by host.  This
change updates heat to allow a 'host' parameter to be passed to the
API, resulting in the engine filtering results based on that parameter.

Change-Id: I94471557e47db1cbd055caa56f76dbf5ee4744f7
Closes-Bug: #1457778

have it on the second node, spawning vms can still fail. Races are
races.

Change-Id: Ia3d734f22813761014c43c0d25be524990791269
"}]
commit_message:
Wait for all ovs agents, rather than just one.

We were waiting for one ovs agent on a compute node, but if we don't
have it on the second node, spawning vms can still fail. Races are
races.

Change-Id: Ia3d734f22813761014c43c0d25be524990791269

subject: Tell Neutron to set VLAN tags for l3 gw ports
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-22 02:36:47.000000000', 'files': ['elements/neutron/os-apply-config/etc/neutron/l3_agent.ini'], 'message': 'Tell Neutron to set VLAN tags for l3 gw ports

Our prior attempt at VLAN support - creating a manual VLAN and putting
br-ex on it was deeply flawed - it interacts badly with multiple
provider networks and requires one bridge per such network, as well as
preventing the use of a provider network that is on the same raw
device due to the vconfig frame forwarding behaviour. This setting
tells Neutron that we want it to set the right vlan tag on the gw
port.

Change-Id: I5b08e7d76e3887365e82c10cc32ef3836bbf4a6a
Related-Bug: #1346494
'}]
commit_message:
Tell Neutron to set VLAN tags for l3 gw ports

Our prior attempt at VLAN support - creating a manual VLAN and putting
br-ex on it was deeply flawed - it interacts badly with multiple
provider networks and requires one bridge per such network, as well as
preventing the use of a provider network that is on the same raw
device due to the vconfig frame forwarding behaviour. This setting
tells Neutron that we want it to set the right vlan tag on the gw
port.

Change-Id: I5b08e7d76e3887365e82c10cc32ef3836bbf4a6a
Related-Bug: #1346494

subject: Draft a 'pxe_logpower' driver
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-09-05 00:07:38.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/logpower.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/iboot.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_logpower.py', 'setup.cfg', 'ironic/drivers/pxe.py'], 'message': "Draft a 'pxe_logpower' driver

This driver logs messages rather than powering nodes on or off. It is
intended to be used in situations where programmatic access to the
infrastructure management place is not permitted (or does not exist).

Examples include machines with no BMC and no PDU, or when trialling
Ironic before it has passed a security review and been approved for
use within the management plane.

Change-Id: Id84870701406f98494ef85102644b565b197620c
"}]
commit_message:
Draft a 'pxe_logpower' driver

This driver logs messages rather than powering nodes on or off. It is
intended to be used in situations where programmatic access to the
infrastructure management place is not permitted (or does not exist).

Examples include machines with no BMC and no PDU, or when trialling
Ironic before it has passed a security review and been approved for
use within the management plane.

Change-Id: Id84870701406f98494ef85102644b565b197620c

subject: Allow multiple refs in source-repositories
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-30 03:48:57.000000000', 'files': ['specs/juno/build-many-patches.rst'], 'message': 'Allow multiple refs in source-repositories

When folk are working on new features they often will need a number of patches
to the same repository. Sometimes this is easy - they are able to reference a
single gerrit review and get a rolled-up ref containing everything. Other times
the patches are quite unrelated and at best pushback will be received from the
review community.

Providing a way to specify a set of patches per tree will allow development in
such cases to be robust and largely independent of the review process.

Change-Id: I0b294bf09604ae1989134dc7704962bd41ef4540
'}]
commit_message:
Allow multiple refs in source-repositories

When folk are working on new features they often will need a number of patches
to the same repository. Sometimes this is easy - they are able to reference a
single gerrit review and get a rolled-up ref containing everything. Other times
the patches are quite unrelated and at best pushback will be received from the
review community.

Providing a way to specify a set of patches per tree will allow development in
such cases to be robust and largely independent of the review process.

Change-Id: I0b294bf09604ae1989134dc7704962bd41ef4540

subject: Increase the Ironic RPC connection pool size.
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-06-30 04:11:20.000000000', 'files': ['elements/ironic/os-apply-config/etc/ironic/ironic.conf'], 'message': 'Increase the Ironic RPC connection pool size.

We were seeing IPMI starvation with the recommended size from
bug 1308680 and found a setting of 100 seemed to work better with
40 nodes. We probably need to test various scales to see if this
is a tunable or a X-value-is-right setting.

Partial-Bug: #1308680
Change-Id: I452033cc452194e955620251c03e00763baef5a2
'}]
commit_message:
Increase the Ironic RPC connection pool size.

We were seeing IPMI starvation with the recommended size from
bug 1308680 and found a setting of 100 seemed to work better with
40 nodes. We probably need to test various scales to see if this
is a tunable or a X-value-is-right setting.

Partial-Bug: #1308680
Change-Id: I452033cc452194e955620251c03e00763baef5a2

subject: Make bootstrapping TripleO development easier.
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-05-02 04:03:53.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/configure-tripleo'], 'message': "Make bootstrapping TripleO development easier.

Folk find getting TripleO up and running tricky - they don't know to
look in ~/.cache/tripleo, or that they need to create an rc file
before doing anything to avoid that.

The approach here to tackle that is to supply a very small script that
is location independent - we can put a link to download it from gitweb
in the main TripleO docs and then its wget; run; away-we-go.

This is still technically WIP: I haven't linked it into the docs, and
the design isn't finalised - e.g. perhaps this script should accept
a destination directory - e.g. download, run configure-tripleo
/path/to/desired/tripleo/root.

Change-Id: I2fe6a03ce3be4624025dc2bc0ec36d7dcd128b4b
"}]
commit_message:
Make bootstrapping TripleO development easier.

Folk find getting TripleO up and running tricky - they don't know to
look in ~/.cache/tripleo, or that they need to create an rc file
before doing anything to avoid that.

The approach here to tackle that is to supply a very small script that
is location independent - we can put a link to download it from gitweb
in the main TripleO docs and then its wget; run; away-we-go.

This is still technically WIP: I haven't linked it into the docs, and
the design isn't finalised - e.g. perhaps this script should accept
a destination directory - e.g. download, run configure-tripleo
/path/to/desired/tripleo/root.

Change-Id: I2fe6a03ce3be4624025dc2bc0ec36d7dcd128b4b

When the storage pool is Initializing, Offline or Deleting, no more LUNs
can be created before the pool gets out of the state.
So when a pool is in the 3 states, its free capacity is de facto 0.

This patch is to add logic to report 0 free capacity accordingly.

Change-Id: I4ef56d48e987795a48e6dcb23615e4b2a7580452
Closes-Bug: #1431233
'}]
commit_message:
VNX Cinder Driver should report 0 free_capacity_gb in some scenarios

When the storage pool is Initializing, Offline or Deleting, no more LUNs
can be created before the pool gets out of the state.
So when a pool is in the 3 states, its free capacity is de facto 0.

This patch is to add logic to report 0 free capacity accordingly.

Change-Id: I4ef56d48e987795a48e6dcb23615e4b2a7580452
Closes-Bug: #1431233

This patch modifies the glusterfs driver code to use "mount" method
in RemoteFsClient class.

This patch does the following:
 * Corrects the passing parameters while creating the object of
RemoteFsClient class.
 * Calls the "mount" method in RemoteFsClient to mount GlusterFS
volumes instead of "_do_mount" method in RemoteFSDriver class.
 * Also removes "_do_mount" method RemoteFSDriver class, as it is

Change-Id: I3bfc76fc3228282a741c5265eb06c4974a696b29

commit_message:
GlusterFS: Using mount method in RemoteFsClient

This patch modifies the glusterfs driver code to use "mount" method
in RemoteFsClient class.

This patch does the following:
 * Corrects the passing parameters while creating the object of
RemoteFsClient class.
 * Calls the "mount" method in RemoteFsClient to mount GlusterFS
volumes instead of "_do_mount" method in RemoteFSDriver class.
 * Also removes "_do_mount" method RemoteFSDriver class, as it is
not required now.

Closes-Bug: 1433520

In case of a NotSupportedError during the CPU comparison, the live
migration was aborted and rolled back because all libvirt errors were
treated equally.
If the target host has the same CPU architecture like the source host,
the live migration gets triggered now, despite no CPU comparison was

'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: handle NotSupportedError in compareCPU

In case of a NotSupportedError during the CPU comparison, the live
migration was aborted and rolled back because all libvirt errors were
treated equally.
If the target host has the same CPU architecture like the source host,
the live migration gets triggered now, despite no CPU comparison was
done.

Closes-Bug: 1434429

Change-Id: I9276f0a7ce9a9b58943e1ed9b9c7d8855482d9cd

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7468, 'name': 'Sergey Vasilenko', 'email': 'svasilenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'xenolog'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9387, 'name': 'Aleksandr Didenko', 'email': 'adidenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'AD'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 14774, 'name': 'Fuel TPI CI', 'email': 'pi-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-tpi-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-22 10:38:25.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': 'Fix rabbit OCF monitor check for running and clustered

W/o this fix, there is a situation possible when the action start
joins the node to the cluster (it becomes visible in db_nodes),
but the monitor action might not see, if it is absent in
the running_db_nodes list.
This is an issue as such node will never start as a cluster
member.

The fix is to check if current node is running and clustered and
return OCF_NOT_RUNNING if it is not.

Closes-bug: #1455761

Change-Id: I8798e776f291ac6de9884c5d07dacd5a4e1d42da
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rabbit OCF monitor check for running and clustered

W/o this fix, there is a situation possible when the action start
joins the node to the cluster (it becomes visible in db_nodes),
but the monitor action might not see, if it is absent in
the running_db_nodes list.
This is an issue as such node will never start as a cluster
member.

The fix is to check if current node is running and clustered and
return OCF_NOT_RUNNING if it is not.

Closes-bug: #1455761

Change-Id: I8798e776f291ac6de9884c5d07dacd5a4e1d42da
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-05-12 03:36:48.000000000', 'files': ['spec/spec_helper.rb', 'manifests/ovs.pp', 'spec/classes/vswitch_ovs_spec.rb', 'manifests/params.pp'], 'message': 'make dkms on Debian/Ubuntu optional, add tests

Adds a parameter to turn off dkms for kernel
module.
By default the old behaviour of the modules stays.
On RedHat this parameter has no function.

Dkms Package for openvswitch are not available
on Debian newer than wheezy and Ubuntu newer
than utopic (or on backports). Which makes
the manifests fail on these systems whithout
setting dkms_ensure to false.

Add some initial rspec tests.

Change-Id: Id20ed728e9ed416ae0ff40e26d61ba3ca022355c
'}]
commit_message:
make dkms on Debian/Ubuntu optional, add tests

Adds a parameter to turn off dkms for kernel
module.
By default the old behaviour of the modules stays.
On RedHat this parameter has no function.

Dkms Package for openvswitch are not available
on Debian newer than wheezy and Ubuntu newer
than utopic (or on backports). Which makes
the manifests fail on these systems whithout
setting dkms_ensure to false.

Add some initial rspec tests.

Change-Id: Id20ed728e9ed416ae0ff40e26d61ba3ca022355c

commit_message:
[PoC] [WIP] Direct calls in dispatcher

Used direct calls to indexer and storage instead api calls in dispacher.
In case of Opentsdb driver it improves performance x10-x12 times.
Now I'm testing current patch performance with ceilometer collector.

Change-Id: I654416d92ec9785ae7fffbe436dddbc23de112b6

subject: Support multiple custom overcloud heat envs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-11 14:14:54.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh'], 'message': 'Support multiple custom overcloud heat envs

This patch supports using multiple entries in your
$CUSTOM_HEAT_ENVIRONMENT setting. To use provide
a space delimited list of Heat environments in the
order you wish them added as heatclient params:

  export OVERCLOUD_CUSTOM_HEAT_ENV="foo.yaml bar.yaml"

Any settings in the later YAML files trump settings in
the earlier ones.

Change-Id: I49224415c65090c2274794fa23e87a3ff399fb04
'}]
commit_message:
Support multiple custom overcloud heat envs

This patch supports using multiple entries in your
$CUSTOM_HEAT_ENVIRONMENT setting. To use provide
a space delimited list of Heat environments in the
order you wish them added as heatclient params:

  export OVERCLOUD_CUSTOM_HEAT_ENV="foo.yaml bar.yaml"

Any settings in the later YAML files trump settings in
the earlier ones.

Change-Id: I49224415c65090c2274794fa23e87a3ff399fb04

commit_message:
Data consistent way of making cinder backups

fs_backup_mode now checks volume_id parameter in conf.
If we have volume_id - we execute cinder backup instead of tar or lvm backup.
As far as mongo_mode, mysql_mode, sql_server_mode are using fs_backup_mode
it will be execute cinder backup in case of provided volume_id parameter,
 otherwise it will execute lvm or tar backup.

Implements blueprint: cinder-backup-mode

Change-Id: I7e70d3a0888cafee87232ab28c8fea48788e5de4

commit_message:
Predeletion check: use systemtype agent instead of version.

The main reason: we never update magents in nodes.
In this case for old env: 5.1 or 6.0 we could not use
'version' magent because it is present only in 6.1 nodes.
But for availabe check we can safely use systemtype
agent.

Change-Id: I7c3875d66255997f16b28c10748dfb23b21f5e85
Closes-Bug: #1455390

commit_message:
Add system tests for the Elasticsearch-Kibana plugin

This change adds tests for the Elasticsearch-Kibana plugin [1].
We are testing the deployment in multi-node with HA with the plugin and
we are checking that:
  - Elasticsearch server is responding
  - Kibana is running
  - OSTF test suite is executed without errors

[1] https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-plugin-elasticsearch-kibana

Change-Id: I3783888f76db8e6346386b656ca261ccc0680994
Closes-Bug: #1453735

the Elasticsearch-Kibana [2] and the InfluxDB-Grafana [3] plugins which

commit_message:
Add field to release for storing valid deploy mode

Field is called `modes`. Cluster validation stops creating the
environment with mode that is not in the `modes` field of cluster
release.

One cluster validation test seemed to have reversed logic
(test_release_non_exists_validation). It is fixed now.

Change-Id: Iafeb988a91f44e29ea0491422b8348997d950bc4
Closes-Bug: #1456540

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11303, 'name': 'Markus Zoeller (markus_z)', 'email': 'mzoeller@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'mzoeller'}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15524, 'name': 'dane-fichter', 'email': 'dane.fichter@jhuapl.edu', 'username': 'dane-fichter'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-21 12:08:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Fix cpu_compare tests and a wrong method when logging

Commit da9301fb tries to special-case a not-supported exception but the
logging bits call a non existant method and also mocking in the test
added was off.

The reason that this passes gate might seems to be that comparing 0 with
a MagicMock object in the libvirt.driver._compare_cpu() method always
fails - which seems to be arbitrary behavior according to:

https://docs.python.org/2/library/stdtypes.html#comparisons

Change-Id: I2732410512fc521e42d4d63ce59c676f2033bf22
Related-bug: #1434429
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Fix cpu_compare tests and a wrong method when logging

Commit da9301fb tries to special-case a not-supported exception but the
logging bits call a non existant method and also mocking in the test
added was off.

The reason that this passes gate might seems to be that comparing 0 with
a MagicMock object in the libvirt.driver._compare_cpu() method always
fails - which seems to be arbitrary behavior according to:

https://docs.python.org/2/library/stdtypes.html#comparisons

Change-Id: I2732410512fc521e42d4d63ce59c676f2033bf22

commit_message:
Installation info filtering rules added to collector

- Rules of filtering installation info added to the application config.
- All data is saved as before, but filtered installation info is marked
  as filtered in the DB.
- Boolean field added to installation info DB model for saving status
  of data filtration.
- DB migration for adding filtration flag added.
- Log level to applictaion logger set explicitly.
- Optional build_id parameter added to installation info JSON schema.
- Adding of migration files handled in the collector base test.
- Requirement for python-dateutil added to the collector requirements.txt

Change-Id: I99626f7f9495a0f36ed70af487d41a647250355b
Partial-Bug: #1443347

Check whether beam is started before running start_app

to start rabbitmq app without running beam
after Mnesia reset getting into the loop

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-21 23:49:40.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': 'Check hostlist against starting and active resources

This commit makes post-start notify action to check
hostlist of nodes that should be joined to the cluster
to contain not only nodes that will be started but
also ones that are already started. This fixes
the case when Pacemaker sends notifies only for
the latest event and thus the node which is not
included into the start list will not join the
cluster. Also it checks whether the node is
already clustered and skips the join if it
is not needed.

Change-Id: Ibe8ecdcfe42c14228350b1eb3c9d08b1a64e117d
Closes-bug: #1455761
'}]
commit_message:
Check hostlist against starting and active resources

This commit makes post-start notify action to check
hostlist of nodes that should be joined to the cluster
to contain not only nodes that will be started but
also ones that are already started. This fixes
the case when Pacemaker sends notifies only for
the latest event and thus the node which is not
included into the start list will not join the
cluster. Also it checks whether the node is
already clustered and skips the join if it
is not needed.

Change-Id: Ibe8ecdcfe42c14228350b1eb3c9d08b1a64e117d
Closes-bug: #1455761

commit_message:
Add wait condition on swarm services in swarm bay

This blocks the heat stack from going into CREATE_COMPLETE status until
all of the swarm services have completely started. This also means that
if the swarm services fail to start, the bay will eventually timeout
instead of going into CREATE_COMPLETE.

Change-Id: I050e206b99793e0a07ba670d141b64592549c61b
Closes-bug: #1452936
Closes-bug: #1457596

commit_message:
Fix loading things in instance_extra for old instances

If we don't have db_inst['extra'] then we can't load those things. We
should just set them to None instead of exploding.

Change-Id: I2ace62158faaa0b6a7df3c32f2cb9f235d178013
Closes-Bug: #1446082

subject: Use stevedore for keystone backends
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 7715, 'name': 'Hirofumi Ichihara', 'email': 'ichihara.hirofumi@gmail.com', 'username': 'Hirofumi-Ichihara'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-11 15:34:31.000000000', 'files': ['lib/keystone'], 'message': 'Use stevedore for keystone backends

With bp stevedore, keystone will load backend drivers using
stevedore entrypoints. Using the qualified class name is
deprecated.

Since stevedore is going to validate that the entrypoint is
found, there's no need to list the valid backends, so backend
validation was removed. This change will cause the server to fail
to start if the backends are misconfigured rather than using the
default one.

The names of the stevedore endpoints are "sql", "ldap", etc.,
rather than the qualified class name, so the way that these
are specified in KEYSTONE_IDENTITY_BACKEND, etc., is the same as
the stevedore entrypoint and there's no need to translate.

Change-Id: I81e4e3a6c97b0057610e6b256aff5df4da884e33
'}]
commit_message:
Use stevedore for keystone backends

With bp stevedore, keystone will load backend drivers using
stevedore entrypoints. Using the qualified class name is
deprecated.

Since stevedore is going to validate that the entrypoint is
found, there's no need to list the valid backends, so backend
validation was removed. This change will cause the server to fail
to start if the backends are misconfigured rather than using the
default one.

The names of the stevedore endpoints are "sql", "ldap", etc.,
rather than the qualified class name, so the way that these
are specified in KEYSTONE_IDENTITY_BACKEND, etc., is the same as
the stevedore entrypoint and there's no need to translate.

Change-Id: I81e4e3a6c97b0057610e6b256aff5df4da884e33

commit_message:
Additional cleanup after compute RPC 3.x removal

This change does some additional cleanup like removing the now orphaned
_spawn() method and a related test. Furthermore it does away with some
rpcapi test stuff that no longer applies and also makes sure we send
objects instead of primitives in all rpcapi tests. Finally, some left-
over parameters in the client-side attach_volume() method are removed
since those are no longer needed.

Change-Id: I74e270304e03a843e6051afcaae7812af5564875

subject: redhat-common: rename 01-clean-old-kernels.sh to drop .sh extension
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-20 14:28:28.000000000', 'files': ['elements/redhat-common/finalise.d/01-clean-old-kernels'], 'message': 'redhat-common: rename 01-clean-old-kernels.sh to drop .sh extension

dib-run-parts filters the acceptable characters in script names,
and "." is not allowed (see $allowed_regex there), so
01-clean-old-kernels.sh is never executed.

Rename it to drop its .sh extension, so it is executed for real.

Change-Id: Ieb633b31214f1accf03b92a2b06590fdf2127b6b
'}]
commit_message:
redhat-common: rename 01-clean-old-kernels.sh to drop .sh extension

dib-run-parts filters the acceptable characters in script names,
and "." is not allowed (see $allowed_regex there), so
01-clean-old-kernels.sh is never executed.

Rename it to drop its .sh extension, so it is executed for real.

Change-Id: Ieb633b31214f1accf03b92a2b06590fdf2127b6b

commit_message:
Remove RAX supported templates

Templates were incorrectly added to the catalog which say supported by
Rackspace by someone who does not work at Rackspace and does not have
Rackspace's permission to add templates to the catalog which say they
are supported by Rackspace.

Change-Id: Ieddc187a9197ce2573732ac52e96f701e48e078b

commit_message:
Leverage timeutils, drop strtime()

This patch remove some code that tried to parse time in different way by
leveraging timeutils instead. It also drops strtime() usage as it's
going to be deprecated in oslo_utils (see
I8b5119e64369ccac3423dccc04421f99912df733).

Change-Id: Ic0036b85768018214dc4fe672e9325b5d04d3c26

Cloud-init and simple-init are not meant to play together. Lets disable

Change-Id: I5bfa9a3e83d3259db2436404034ad58c780de1c9

commit_message:
Simple-init should disable cloud-init

Cloud-init and simple-init are not meant to play together. Lets disable
cloud-init if simple-init is installed.

Also guarding cloud-init-datasources against running in an environment
where cloud-init is not installed.

Change-Id: I5bfa9a3e83d3259db2436404034ad58c780de1c9

subject: Disable firewalld always
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-15 09:14:32.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova_plugins/functions-libvirt', 'tools/fixup_stuff.sh'], 'message': "Disable firewalld always

We've bike-sheded over this before
(I5252a12223a35f7fb7a4ac3c58aa4a3cd1bc4799) but I have just traced
down further issues to firewalld with neutron+ipv6 (see the bug).

In fact, as mentioned in the comments, RDO disables firewalld and the
neutron guide says to disable it [1].  The force flag is left if
anyone really wants this; but nobody is testing (or, as far as I can
tell, working on) this so bring devstack back into line and disable it
always.  Note we do not remove the package; as has been found in the
puppet scripts this can lead to dependency issues.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/guides/neutron.html

Change-Id: Ief7cb33d926a9538f4eb39c74d906ee0c879de35
Partial-Bug: 1455303
"}]
commit_message:
Disable firewalld always

We've bike-sheded over this before
(I5252a12223a35f7fb7a4ac3c58aa4a3cd1bc4799) but I have just traced
down further issues to firewalld with neutron+ipv6 (see the bug).

In fact, as mentioned in the comments, RDO disables firewalld and the
neutron guide says to disable it [1].  The force flag is left if
anyone really wants this; but nobody is testing (or, as far as I can
tell, working on) this so bring devstack back into line and disable it
always.  Note we do not remove the package; as has been found in the
puppet scripts this can lead to dependency issues.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/guides/neutron.html

Change-Id: Ief7cb33d926a9538f4eb39c74d906ee0c879de35
Partial-Bug: 1455303

subject: Do not set OS_CACERT if there is no CA cert
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 8119, 'name': 'Eric Brown', 'email': 'eric_wade_brown@yahoo.com', 'username': 'ericwb'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-06 20:55:22.000000000', 'files': ['openrc'], 'message': 'Do not set OS_CACERT if there is no CA cert

In openrc, if we set OS_CACERT, some things will expect it to be there
in pre-flight checks. But it may very well be missing. This "fails
closed" because if we find the file, we try to use it, but if we don't
find the file, and the user thought we should be using it, we'll just
not be able to verify the server's name, and the libs will fail on that.

Change-Id: Ia5d06afa74bc645c2f19711cfa37e57a377c329b
Closes-Bug: #1452036
'}]
commit_message:
Do not set OS_CACERT if there is no CA cert

In openrc, if we set OS_CACERT, some things will expect it to be there
in pre-flight checks. But it may very well be missing. This "fails
closed" because if we find the file, we try to use it, but if we don't
find the file, and the user thought we should be using it, we'll just
not be able to verify the server's name, and the libs will fail on that.

Change-Id: Ia5d06afa74bc645c2f19711cfa37e57a377c329b
Closes-Bug: #1452036

commit_message:
Non-json body on POST 500's

If the body of a POST request is not json, we get crashes.
This can happen when middleware sends along unexpected data.

Closes-bug #1441879

Change-Id: Ifac59476e4785b86bca6e2a54759f4271629a193

This drops all the things we no longer need when not supporting the

run_instance() path and the mass of tests that hit that route. There

commit_message:
Drop compute RPC 3.x support

This drops all the things we no longer need when not supporting the
compute RPC 3.x interface. The major changes are removing of the
run_instance() path and the mass of tests that hit that route. There
are also quite a few tests that still depend on object_compat
decorations on compute manager methods, which require some
changes here.

Change-Id: I60a89bf7884dbcb066c63101168b359013fe832b

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-11 13:39:19.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/disk/vfs/localfs.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/disk/vfs/test_localfs.py'], 'message': 'Handle return code 2 from blkid calls

blkid returns code 2 if the requested TYPE key is not found
for the specified device.

Ensure that this situation is handled correctly; blkid will
not return any data, so the return value will be empty.

Change-Id: I38cd7b53cdfd694c0eba1b6054d8e4c33759b0b8
Closes-Bug: #1426324
'}]
commit_message:
Handle return code 2 from blkid calls

blkid returns code 2 if the requested TYPE key is not found
for the specified device.

Ensure that this situation is handled correctly; blkid will
not return any data, so the return value will be empty.

Change-Id: I38cd7b53cdfd694c0eba1b6054d8e4c33759b0b8
Closes-Bug: #1426324

subject: Virtuozzo Storage volume driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-19 17:03:38.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/vzstorage-volume-driver.rst'], 'message': "Virtuozzo Storage volume driver

Add spec for Virtuozzo Storage volume driver.

Virtuozzo Storage is a fault-tolerant distributed storage
system optimized for virtualization workloads. From client's
point of view it looks like network attached storage (NFS or
GlusterFS).

blueprint virtuozzo-cloud-storage-support

Change-Id: I71ded4fe3e33d45880d1327e945657728454657e
"}]
commit_message:
Virtuozzo Storage volume driver

Add spec for Virtuozzo Storage volume driver.

Virtuozzo Storage is a fault-tolerant distributed storage
system optimized for virtualization workloads. From client's
point of view it looks like network attached storage (NFS or
GlusterFS).

blueprint virtuozzo-cloud-storage-support

Change-Id: I71ded4fe3e33d45880d1327e945657728454657e
